cbca_root.label: CBCA
cbca_root.title: Canada Business Corporations Act
cbca_root.text: An Act respecting Canadian business corporations

metadata.long_title: An Act respecting Canadian business corporations

cbca_s1.title: Short title
cbca_s1.text: This Act may be cited as the Canada Business Corporations Act.

cbca_s2_2.title: Affiliated bodies corporate
cbca_s2_2.text: For the purposes of this Act,

cbca_s2_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s2_2_a.text: one body corporate is affiliated with another body corporate if one of them is the subsidiary of the other or both are subsidiaries of the same body corporate or each of them is controlled by the same person; and

cbca_s2_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s2_2_b.text: if two bodies corporate are affiliated with the same body corporate at the same time, they are deemed to be affiliated with each other.

cbca_s2_3.title: Control
cbca_s2_3.text: For the purposes of this Act, a body corporate is controlled by a person or by two or more bodies corporate if

cbca_s2_3_a.label: (a)
cbca_s2_3_a.text: securities of the body corporate to which are attached more than fifty per cent of the votes that may be cast to elect directors of the body corporate are held, other than by way of security only, by or for the benefit of that person or by or for the benefit of those bodies corporate; and

cbca_s2_3_b.label: (b)
cbca_s2_3_b.text: the votes attached to those securities are sufficient, if exercised, to elect a majority of the directors of the body corporate.

cbca_s2_4.title: Holding body corporate
cbca_s2_4.text: A body corporate is the holding body corporate of another if that other body corporate is its subsidiary.

cbca_s2_5.title: Subsidiary body corporate
cbca_s2_5.text: A body corporate is a subsidiary of another body corporate if

cbca_s2_5_a_ii.label: (ii)
cbca_s2_5_a_ii.text: that other body corporate and one or more bodies corporate each of which is controlled by that other body corporate, or

cbca_s2_5_a_iii.label: (iii)
cbca_s2_5_a_iii.text: two or more bodies corporate each of which is controlled by that other body corporate; or

cbca_s2_5_b.label: (b)
cbca_s2_5_b.text: it is a subsidiary of a body corporate that is a subsidiary of that other body corporate.

cbca_s2_6.title: Exemptions — on application by corporation
cbca_s2_6.text: On the application of a corporation, the Director may determine that the corporation is not or was not a distributing corporation if the Director is satisfied that the determination would not be prejudicial to the public interest.

cbca_s2_7.title: Exemptions — classes of corporations
cbca_s2_7.text: The Director may determine that a class of corporations are not or were not distributing corporations if the Director is satisfied that the determination would not be prejudicial to the public interest.

cbca_s2_8.title: Infants
cbca_s2_8.text: For the purposes of this Act, the word infant has the same meaning as in the applicable provincial law and, in the absence of any such law, has the same meaning as the word child in the United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child, adopted in the United Nations General Assembly on November 20, 1989.

cbca_s2.1_1.text: For the purposes of this Act, any of the following individuals is an individual with significant control over a corporation:

cbca_s2.1_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s2.1_1_a.text: an individual who has any of the following interests or rights, or any combination of them, in respect of a significant number of shares of the corporation:

cbca_s2.1_1_a_i.label: (i)
cbca_s2.1_1_a_i.text: the individual is the registered holder of them,

cbca_s2.1_1_a_ii.label: (ii)
cbca_s2.1_1_a_ii.text: the individual is the beneficial owner of them, or

cbca_s2.1_1_a_iii.label: (iii)
cbca_s2.1_1_a_iii.text: the individual has direct or indirect control or direction over them;

cbca_s2.1_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s2.1_1_b.text: an individual who has any direct or indirect influence that, if exercised, would result in control in fact of the corporation; or

cbca_s2.1_1_c.label: (c)
cbca_s2.1_1_c.text: an individual to whom prescribed circumstances apply.

cbca_s2.1_2.title: Joint ownership or control
cbca_s2.1_2.text: Two or more individuals are each considered to be an individual with significant control over a corporation if, in respect of a significant number of shares of the corporation,

cbca_s2.1_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s2.1_2_a.text: an interest or right, or a combination of interests or rights, referred to in paragraph (1)(a) is held jointly by those individuals; or

cbca_s2.1_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s2.1_2_b.text: a right, or combination of rights, referred to in paragraph (1)(a) is subject to any agreement or arrangement under which the right or rights are to be exercised jointly or in concert by those individuals.

cbca_s2.1_3.title: Significant number of shares
cbca_s2.1_3.text: For the purposes of this section, a significant number of shares of a corporation is

cbca_s2.1_3_a.label: (a)
cbca_s2.1_3_a.text: any number of shares that carry 25% or more of the voting rights attached to all of the corporation’s outstanding voting shares; or

cbca_s2.1_3_b.label: (b)
cbca_s2.1_3_b.text: any number of shares that is equal to 25% or more of all of the corporation’s outstanding shares measured by fair market value.

cbca_s3_1.text: This Act applies to every corporation incorporated and every body corporate continued as a corporation under this Act that has not been discontinued under this Act.

cbca_s3_3.title: Certain Acts do not apply
cbca_s3_3.text: The following do not apply to a corporation:

cbca_s3_3_b.label: (b)
cbca_s3_3_b.text: the Winding-up and Restructuring Act; and

cbca_s3_3_c.label: (c)
cbca_s3_3_c.text: the provisions of a Special Act, as defined in section 87 of the Canada Transportation Act, that are inconsistent with this Act.

cbca_s3_4.title: Limitations on business that may be carried on
cbca_s3_4.text: No corporation shall carry on the business of

cbca_s3_4_a.1.label: (a.1)
cbca_s3_4_a.1.text: an association to which the Cooperative Credit Associations Act applies;

cbca_s3_4_b.label: (b)
cbca_s3_4_b.text: a company or society to which the Insurance Companies Act applies; or

cbca_s3_4_c.label: (c)
cbca_s3_4_c.text: a company to which the Trust and Loan Companies Act applies.

cbca_s3_5.title: Limitations on business that may be carried on
cbca_s3_5.text: No corporation shall carry on business as a degree-granting educational institution unless expressly authorized to do so by a federal or provincial agent that by law has the power to confer degree-granting authority on an educational institution.

cbca_part_i_heading_purposes_of_act.title: Purposes of Act
cbca_part_i_heading_purposes_of_act.full_citation: CBCA PART I - Purposes of Act

cbca_s4.title: Purposes
cbca_s4.text: The purposes of this Act are to revise and reform the law applicable to business corporations incorporated to carry on business throughout Canada, to advance the cause of uniformity of business corporation law in Canada and to provide a means of allowing an orderly transferance of certain federal companies incorporated under various Acts of Parliament to this Act.

cbca_s5_1.text: One or more individuals or bodies corporate may incorporate a corporation by signing articles of incorporation and complying with section 7.

cbca_s5_2.title: Individuals
cbca_s5_2.text: An individual may incorporate a corporation only if that individual

cbca_s5_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s5_2_a.text: is not less than 18 years of age;

cbca_s5_2_c.label: (c)
cbca_s5_2_c.text: does not have the status of bankrupt.

cbca_s6_1.text: Articles of incorporation shall follow the form that the Director fixes and shall set out, in respect of the proposed corporation,

cbca_s6_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s6_1_b.text: the province in Canada where the registered office is to be situated;

cbca_s6_1_c.label: (c)
cbca_s6_1_c.text: the classes and any maximum number of shares that the corporation is authorized to issue, and

cbca_s6_1_c_i.label: (i)
cbca_s6_1_c_i.text: if there will be two or more classes of shares, the rights, privileges, restrictions and conditions attaching to each class of shares, and

cbca_s6_1_c_ii.label: (ii)
cbca_s6_1_c_ii.text: if a class of shares may be issued in series, the authority given to the directors to fix the number of shares in, and to determine the designation of, and the rights, privileges, restrictions and conditions attaching to, the shares of each series;

cbca_s6_1_d.label: (d)
cbca_s6_1_d.text: if the issue, transfer or ownership of shares of the corporation is to be restricted, a statement to that effect and a statement as to the nature of such restrictions;

cbca_s6_1_e.label: (e)
cbca_s6_1_e.text: the number of directors or, subject to paragraph 107(a), the minimum and maximum number of directors of the corporation; and

cbca_s6_1_f.label: (f)
cbca_s6_1_f.text: any restrictions on the businesses that the corporation may carry on.

cbca_s6_2.title: Additional provisions in articles
cbca_s6_2.text: The articles may set out any provisions permitted by this Act or by law to be set out in the by-laws of the corporation.

cbca_s6_3.title: Special majorities
cbca_s6_3.text: Subject to subsection (4), if the articles or a unanimous shareholder agreement require a greater number of votes of directors or shareholders than that required by this Act to effect any action, the provisions of the articles or of the unanimous shareholder agreement prevail.

cbca_s6_4.title: Idem
cbca_s6_4.text: The articles may not require a greater number of votes of shareholders to remove a director than the number required by section 109.

cbca_s7.title: Delivery of articles of incorporation
cbca_s7.text: An incorporator shall send to the Director articles of incorporation and the documents required by sections 19 and 106.

cbca_s8_1.text: Subject to subsection (2), on receipt of articles of incorporation, the Director shall issue a certificate of incorporation in accordance with section 262.

cbca_s8_2.title: Exception — failure to comply with Act
cbca_s8_2.text: The Director may refuse to issue the certificate if a notice that is required to be sent under subsection 19(2) or 106(1) indicates that the corporation, if it came into existence, would not be in compliance with this Act.

cbca_s9.title: Effect of certificate
cbca_s9.text: A corporation comes into existence on the date shown in the certificate of incorporation.

cbca_s10_1.text: The word or expression “Limited”, “Limitée”, “Incorporated”, “Incorporée”, “Corporation” or “Société par actions de régime fédéral” or the corresponding abbreviation “Ltd.”, “Ltée”, “Inc.”, “Corp.” or “S.A.R.F.” shall be part, other than only in a figurative or descriptive sense, of the name of every corporation, but a corporation may use and be legally designated by either the full or the corresponding abbreviated form.

cbca_s10_1.1.title: Saving for “S.C.C.”
cbca_s10_1.1.text: Subsection (1) does not apply to a corporation that has a corporate name that, immediately before the day on which this subsection comes into force, included, other than only in a figurative or descriptive sense, the expression “Société commerciale canadienne” or the abbreviation “S.C.C.”, and any such corporation may use and be legally designated by either that expression or that abbreviation.

cbca_s10_2.title: Exemption
cbca_s10_2.text: The Director may exempt a body corporate continued as a corporation under this Act from the provisions of subsection (1).

cbca_s10_3.title: Alternate name
cbca_s10_3.text: Subject to subsection 12(1), the name of a corporation may be set out in its articles in an English form, a French form, an English form and a French form, or a combined English and French form, so long as the combined form meets the prescribed criteria. The corporation may use and may be legally designated by any such form.

cbca_s10_4.title: Alternative name outside Canada
cbca_s10_4.text: Subject to subsection 12(1), a corporation may, for use outside Canada, set out its name in its articles in any language form and it may use and may be legally designated by any such form outside Canada.

cbca_s10_5.title: Publication of name
cbca_s10_5.text: A corporation shall set out its name in legible characters in all contracts, invoices, negotiable instruments and orders for goods or services issued or made by or on behalf of the corporation.

cbca_s10_6.title: Other name
cbca_s10_6.text: Subject to subsections (5) and 12(1), a corporation may carry on business under or identify itself by a name other than its corporate name if that other name does not contain, other than in a figurative or descriptive sense, either the word or expression “Limited”, “Limitée”, “Incorporated”, “Incorporée”, “Corporation” or “Société par actions de régime fédéral” or the corresponding abbreviation.

cbca_s11_1.text: The Director may, on request, reserve for a prescribed period a name for an intended corporation or for a corporation that intends to change its name.

cbca_s11_2.title: Designating number
cbca_s11_2.text: If requested to do so by the incorporators or a corporation, the Director shall assign to the corporation as its name a designating number followed by the word “Canada” and a word or expression, or the corresponding abbreviation, referred to in subsection 10(1).

cbca_s12_1.text: A corporation shall not be incorporated or continued as a corporation under this Act with, change its name to, or have, carry on business under or identify itself by a name that is prohibited by the regulations or that does not meet the prescribed requirements.

cbca_s12_2.title: Directing change of name
cbca_s12_2.text: The Director may direct a corporation to change its name in accordance with section 173 if, through inadvertence or otherwise, the corporation acquires a name that is prohibited by the regulations or that does not meet the prescribed requirements.

cbca_s12_4.title: Idem
cbca_s12_4.text: If a corporation has a designating number as its name, the Director may direct the corporation to change its name to a name other than a designating number in accordance with section 173.

cbca_s12_4.1.title: Undertaking to change name
cbca_s12_4.1.text: Where a corporation acquires a name as a result of a person undertaking to dissolve or to change names, and the undertaking is not honoured, the Director may direct the corporation to change its name in accordance with section 173, unless the undertaking is honoured within the period specified in subsection (5).

cbca_s12_5.title: Revoking name
cbca_s12_5.text: If a corporation has not followed a directive under subsection (2), (4) or (4.1) within the prescribed period, the Director may revoke the name of the corporation and assign a name to it and, until changed in accordance with section 173, the name of the corporation is the name assigned by the Director.

cbca_s13_1.text: When a corporation has had its name revoked and a name assigned to it under subsection 12(5), the Director shall issue a certificate of amendment showing the new name of the corporation and shall give notice of the change of name as soon as practicable in a publication generally available to the public.

cbca_s13_2.title: Effect of certificate
cbca_s13_2.text: The articles of the corporation are amended accordingly on the date shown in the certificate of amendment.

cbca_s14_1.text: Subject to this section, a person who enters into, or purports to enter into, a written contract in the name of or on behalf of a corporation before it comes into existence is personally bound by the contract and is entitled to its benefits.

cbca_s14_2.title: Pre-incorporation and pre-amalgamation contracts
cbca_s14_2.text: A corporation may, within a reasonable time after it comes into existence, by any action or conduct signifying its intention to be bound thereby, adopt a written contract made before it came into existence in its name or on its behalf, and on such adoption

cbca_s14_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s14_2_a.text: the corporation is bound by the contract and is entitled to the benefits thereof as if the corporation had been in existence at the date of the contract and had been a party thereto; and

cbca_s14_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s14_2_b.text: a person who purported to act in the name of or on behalf of the corporation ceases, except as provided in subsection (3), to be bound by or entitled to the benefits of the contract.

cbca_s14_3.title: Application to court
cbca_s14_3.text: Subject to subsection (4), whether or not a written contract made before the coming into existence of a corporation is adopted by the corporation, a party to the contract may apply to a court for an order respecting the nature and extent of the obligations and liability under the contract of the corporation and the person who entered into, or purported to enter into, the contract in the name of or on behalf of the corporation. On the application, the court may make any order it thinks fit.

cbca_s14_4.title: Exemption from personal liability
cbca_s14_4.text: If expressly so provided in the written contract, a person who purported to act in the name of or on behalf of the corporation before it came into existence is not in any event bound by the contract or entitled to the benefits thereof.

cbca_s15_1.text: A corporation has the capacity and, subject to this Act, the rights, powers and privileges of a natural person.

cbca_s15_2.title: Idem
cbca_s15_2.text: A corporation may carry on business throughout Canada.

cbca_s15_3.title: Extra-territorial capacity
cbca_s15_3.text: A corporation has the capacity to carry on its business, conduct its affairs and exercise its powers in any jurisdiction outside Canada to the extent that the laws of such jurisdiction permit.

cbca_s16_1.text: It is not necessary for a by-law to be passed in order to confer any particular power on the corporation or its directors.

cbca_s16_2.title: Restricted business or powers
cbca_s16_2.text: A corporation shall not carry on any business or exercise any power that it is restricted by its articles from carrying on or exercising, nor shall the corporation exercise any of its powers in a manner contrary to its articles.

cbca_s16_3.title: Rights preserved
cbca_s16_3.text: No act of a corporation, including any transfer of property to or by a corporation, is invalid by reason only that the act or transfer is contrary to its articles or this Act.

cbca_s17.title: No constructive notice
cbca_s17.text: No person is affected by or is deemed to have notice or knowledge of the contents of a document concerning a corporation by reason only that the document has been filed by the Director or is available for inspection at an office of the corporation.

cbca_s18.title: Authority of directors, officers and agents

cbca_s18_1.text: No corporation and no guarantor of an obligation of a corporation may assert against a person dealing with the corporation or against a person who acquired rights from the corporation that

cbca_s18_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s18_1_a.text: the articles, by-laws and any unanimous shareholder agreement have not been complied with;

cbca_s18_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s18_1_b.text: the persons named in the most recent notice sent to the Director under section 106 or 113 are not the directors of the corporation;

cbca_s18_1_c.label: (c)
cbca_s18_1_c.text: the place named in the most recent notice sent to the Director under section 19 is not the registered office of the corporation;

cbca_s18_1_d.label: (d)
cbca_s18_1_d.text: a person held out by a corporation as a director, officer, agent or mandatary of the corporation has not been duly appointed or has no authority to exercise the powers and perform the duties that are customary in the business of the corporation or usual for a director, officer, agent or mandatary;

cbca_s18_1_e.label: (e)
cbca_s18_1_e.text: a document issued by any director, officer, agent or mandatary of a corporation with actual or usual authority to issue the document is not valid or genuine; or

cbca_s18_1_f.label: (f)
cbca_s18_1_f.text: a sale, lease or exchange of property referred to in subsection 189(3) was not authorized.

cbca_s18_2.title: Exception
cbca_s18_2.text: Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of a person who has, or ought to have, knowledge of a situation described in that subsection by virtue of their relationship to the corporation.

cbca_s19_1.text: A corporation shall at all times have a registered office in the province in Canada specified in its articles.

cbca_s19_2.title: Notice of registered office
cbca_s19_2.text: A notice of registered office in the form that the Director fixes shall be sent to the Director together with any articles that designate or change the province where the registered office of the corporation is located.

cbca_s19_3.title: Change of address
cbca_s19_3.text: The directors of a corporation may change the place and address of the registered office within the province specified in the articles.

cbca_s19_4.title: Notice of change of address
cbca_s19_4.text: A corporation shall send to the Director, within fifteen days of any change of address of its registered office, a notice in the form that the Director fixes and the Director shall file it.

cbca_s20_1.text: A corporation shall prepare and maintain, at its registered office or at any other place in Canada designated by the directors, records containing

cbca_s20_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s20_1_a.text: the articles and the by-laws, and all amendments thereto, and a copy of any unanimous shareholder agreement;

cbca_s20_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s20_1_b.text: minutes of meetings and resolutions of shareholders;

cbca_s20_1_c.label: (c)
cbca_s20_1_c.text: copies of all notices required by section 106 or 113; and

cbca_s20_1_d.label: (d)
cbca_s20_1_d.text: a securities register that complies with section 50.

cbca_s20_2.title: Directors records
cbca_s20_2.text: In addition to the records described in subsection (1), a corporation shall prepare and maintain adequate accounting records and records containing minutes of meetings and resolutions of the directors and any committee thereof.

cbca_s20_2.1.title: Retention of accounting records
cbca_s20_2.1.text: Subject to any other Act of Parliament and to any Act of the legislature of a province that provides for a longer retention period, a corporation shall retain the accounting records referred to in subsection (2) for a period of six years after the end of the financial year to which the records relate.

cbca_s20_3.title: Records of continued corporations
cbca_s20_3.text: For the purposes of paragraph (1)(b) and subsection (2), where a body corporate is continued under this Act, “records” includes similar records required by law to be maintained by the body corporate before it was so continued.

cbca_s20_4.title: Place of directors records
cbca_s20_4.text: The records described in subsection (2) shall be kept at the registered office of the corporation or at such other place as the directors think fit and shall at all reasonable times be open to inspection by the directors.

cbca_s20_5.title: Records in Canada
cbca_s20_5.text: If accounting records of a corporation are kept outside Canada, accounting records adequate to enable the directors to ascertain the financial position of the corporation with reasonable accuracy on a quarterly basis shall be kept at the registered office or any other place in Canada designated by the directors.

cbca_s20_5.1.title: When records or registers kept outside Canada
cbca_s20_5.1.text: Despite subsections (1) and (5), but subject to the Income Tax Act, the Excise Tax Act, the Customs Act and any other Act administered by the Minister of National Revenue, a corporation may keep all or any of its corporate records and accounting records referred to in subsection (1) or (2) at a place outside Canada, if

cbca_s20_5.1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s20_5.1_a.text: the records are available for inspection, by means of a computer terminal or other technology, during regular office hours at the registered office or any other place in Canada designated by the directors; and

cbca_s20_5.1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s20_5.1_b.text: the corporation provides the technical assistance to facilitate an inspection referred to in paragraph (a).

cbca_s20_6.title: Offence
cbca_s20_6.text: A corporation that, without reasonable cause, fails to comply with this section is guilty of an offence and liable on summary conviction to a fine not exceeding five thousand dollars.

cbca_s21_1.text: Subject to subsection (1.1), shareholders and creditors of a corporation, their personal representatives and the Director may examine the records described in subsection 20(1) during the usual business hours of the corporation, and may take extracts from the records, free of charge, and, if the corporation is a distributing corporation, any other person may do so on payment of a reasonable fee.

cbca_s21_1.1.title: Requirement for affidavit — securities register
cbca_s21_1.1.text: Any person described in subsection (1) who wishes to examine the securities register of a distributing corporation must first make a request to the corporation or its agent or mandatary, accompanied by an affidavit referred to in subsection (7). On receipt of the affidavit, the corporation or its agent or mandatary shall allow the applicant access to the securities register during the corporation’s usual business hours, and, on payment of a reasonable fee, provide the applicant with an extract from the securities register.

cbca_s21_2.title: Copies of corporate records
cbca_s21_2.text: A shareholder of a corporation is entitled on request and without charge to one copy of the articles and by-laws and of any unanimous shareholder agreement.

cbca_s21_3.title: Shareholder lists
cbca_s21_3.text: Shareholders and creditors of a corporation, their personal representatives, the Director and, if the corporation is a distributing corporation, any other person, on payment of a reasonable fee and on sending to a corporation or its agent or mandatary the affidavit referred to in subsection (7), may on application require the corporation or its agent or mandatary to provide within 10 days after the receipt of the affidavit a list (in this section referred to as the “basic list”) made up to a date not more than 10 days before the date of receipt of the affidavit setting out the names of the shareholders of the corporation, the number of shares owned by each shareholder and the address of each shareholder as shown on the records of the corporation.

cbca_s21_4.title: Supplemental lists
cbca_s21_4.text: A person requiring a corporation to provide a basic list may, by stating in the affidavit referred to in subsection (3) that they require supplemental lists, require the corporation or its agent or mandatary on payment of a reasonable fee to provide supplemental lists setting out any changes from the basic list in the names or addresses of the shareholders and the number of shares owned by each shareholder for each business day following the date the basic list is made up to.

cbca_s21_5.title: When supplemental lists to be provided
cbca_s21_5.text: The corporation or its agent or mandatary shall provide a supplemental list required under subsection (4)

cbca_s21_5_a.label: (a)
cbca_s21_5_a.text: on the date the basic list is furnished, where the information relates to changes that took place prior to that date; and

cbca_s21_5_b.label: (b)
cbca_s21_5_b.text: on the business day following the day to which the supplemental list relates, where the information relates to changes that take place on or after the date the basic list is furnished.

cbca_s21_6.title: Holders of options
cbca_s21_6.text: A person requiring a corporation to furnish a basic list or a supplemental list may also require the corporation to include in that list the name and address of any known holder of an option or right to acquire shares of the corporation.

cbca_s21_7.title: Contents of affidavit
cbca_s21_7.text: The affidavit required under subsection (1.1) or (3) shall state

cbca_s21_7_a.label: (a)
cbca_s21_7_a.text: the name and address of the applicant;

cbca_s21_7_b.label: (b)
cbca_s21_7_b.text: the name and address for service of the body corporate, if the applicant is a body corporate; and

cbca_s21_7_c.label: (c)
cbca_s21_7_c.text: that the basic list and any supplemental lists obtained pursuant to subsection (4) or the information contained in the securities register obtained pursuant to subsection (1.1), as the case may be, will not be used except as permitted under subsection (9).

cbca_s21_8.title: Idem
cbca_s21_8.text: If the applicant is a body corporate, the affidavit shall be made by a director or officer of the body corporate.

cbca_s21_9.title: Use of information or shareholder list
cbca_s21_9.text: A list of shareholders or information from a securities register obtained under this section shall not be used by any person except in connection with

cbca_s21_9_a.label: (a)
cbca_s21_9_a.text: an effort to influence the voting of shareholders of the corporation;

cbca_s21_9_b.label: (b)
cbca_s21_9_b.text: an offer to acquire securities of the corporation; or

cbca_s21_9_c.label: (c)
cbca_s21_9_c.text: any other matter relating to the affairs of the corporation.

cbca_s21_10.title: Offence
cbca_s21_10.text: A person who, without reasonable cause, contravenes this section is guilty of an offence and liable on summary conviction to a fine not exceeding five thousand dollars or to imprisonment for a term not exceeding six months or to both.

cbca_s21.1_1.text: The corporation shall prepare and maintain, at its registered office or at any other place in Canada designated by the directors, a register of individuals with significant control over the corporation that contains

cbca_s21.1_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s21.1_1_a.text: for each individual with significant control,

cbca_s21.1_1_a_i.label: (i)
cbca_s21.1_1_a_i.text: their name and date of birth,

cbca_s21.1_1_a_iii.label: (iii)
cbca_s21.1_1_a_iii.text: their address for service, if it has been provided to the corporation;

cbca_s21.1_1_a.1.label: (a.1)
cbca_s21.1_1_a.1.text: the citizenship of each individual with significant control;

cbca_s21.1_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s21.1_1_b.text: the jurisdiction of residence for tax purposes of each individual with significant control;

cbca_s21.1_1_c.label: (c)
cbca_s21.1_1_c.text: the day on which each individual became or ceased to be an individual with significant control, as the case may be;

cbca_s21.1_1_d.label: (d)
cbca_s21.1_1_d.text: a description of how each individual is an individual with significant control over the corporation, including, as applicable, a description of their interests and rights in respect of shares of the corporation;

cbca_s21.1_1_f.label: (f)
cbca_s21.1_1_f.text: a description of each step taken in accordance with subsection (2).

cbca_s21.1_2.title: Updating of information
cbca_s21.1_2.text: The corporation shall, at the following times, take reasonable steps to ensure that it has identified all individuals with significant control over the corporation and that the information in the register is accurate, complete and up-to-date:

cbca_s21.1_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s21.1_2_a.text: at least once during each financial year of the corporation;

cbca_s21.1_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s21.1_2_b.text: on the request of the Director; and

cbca_s21.1_2_c.label: (c)
cbca_s21.1_2_c.text: at the times provided for in the regulations.

cbca_s21.1_3.title: Recording of information
cbca_s21.1_3.text: If the corporation becomes aware of any information referred to in paragraphs (1)(a) to (e) as a result of steps taken in accordance with subsection (2) or through any other means, the corporation shall record that information in the register within 15 days of becoming aware of it.

cbca_s21.1_4.title: Information from shareholders
cbca_s21.1_4.text: If the corporation requests information referred to in any of paragraphs (1)(a) to (e) from one of its shareholders, the shareholder shall, to the best of their knowledge, reply accurately and completely as soon as feasible.

cbca_s21.1_5.title: Disposal of personal information
cbca_s21.1_5.text: Within one year after the sixth anniversary of the day on which an individual ceases to be an individual with significant control over the corporation, the corporation shall — subject to any other Act of Parliament and to any Act of the legislature of a province that provides for a longer retention period — dispose of any of that individual’s personal information, as defined in subsection 2(1) of the Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act, that is recorded in the register.

cbca_s21.1_6.title: Offence
cbca_s21.1_6.text: A corporation that, without reasonable cause, contravenes this section is guilty of an offence and liable on summary conviction to a fine not exceeding $100,000.

cbca_s21.1_7.title: Non-application
cbca_s21.1_7.text: This section does not apply to a corporation

cbca_s21.1_7_a.label: (a)
cbca_s21.1_7_a.text: that is a reporting issuer or an émetteur assujetti under an Act of the legislature of a province relating to the regulation of securities;

cbca_s21.1_7_b.label: (b)
cbca_s21.1_7_b.text: any of the securities of which are listed and posted for trading on a designated stock exchange, as defined in subsection 248(1) of the Income Tax Act; or

cbca_s21.1_7_c.label: (c)
cbca_s21.1_7_c.text: that is a member of a prescribed class.

cbca_s21.2.title: Inability to identify individuals
cbca_s21.2.text: A corporation to which section 21.1 applies shall take prescribed steps if it is unable to identify any individuals with significant control over the corporation.

cbca_s21.21_1.text: A corporation to which section 21.1 applies shall send to the Director

cbca_s21.21_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s21.21_1_a.text: on an annual basis, the information determined by the Director from among that in its register of individuals with significant control over the corporation, in the form and within the period that the Director fixes; and

cbca_s21.21_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s21.21_1_b.text: the information determined by the Director from among that recorded under subsection 21.1(3), within 15 days after the day on which it is recorded and in the form that the Director fixes.

cbca_s21.21_2.title: Sending of information — certificates issued
cbca_s21.21_2.text: On or after the date shown on a certificate referred to in section 8 or subsection 185(4) or 187(4), a corporation to which section 21.1 applies shall send to the Director the information determined by the Director from among that referred to in paragraphs 21.1(1)(a) to (f), in the form and within the period that the Director fixes.

cbca_s21.21_3.title: Period for keeping and producing information
cbca_s21.21_3.text: The Director is not required to keep or produce any information received under subsection (1) or (2) after the end of the six-year period following the day on which it is received.

cbca_s21.21_4.title: Offence
cbca_s21.21_4.text: A corporation that, without reasonable cause, contravenes subsection (1) or (2) is guilty of an offence and liable on summary conviction to a fine not exceeding $100,000.

cbca_s21.3_1.text: A corporation to which section 21.1 applies shall disclose to the Director, on request, any information in its register of individuals with significant control.

cbca_s21.301.title: Provision of information by Director
cbca_s21.301.text: The Director may provide all or part of the information received under section 21.21 to an investigative body referred to in subsection 21.31(2), the Financial Transactions and Reports Analysis Centre of Canada or any prescribed entity.

cbca_s21.302.title: Provision of information by Director
cbca_s21.302.text: The Director may provide all or part of the information received under section 21.21 to a provincial corporate registry or a provincial government department or agency that is responsible for corporate law in that province.

cbca_s21.303_1.text: The Director shall make available to the public the following information sent to the Director under section 21.21 for each individual with significant control:

cbca_s21.303_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s21.303_1_b.text: their address for service, if it has been provided to the corporation;

cbca_s21.303_1_c.label: (c)
cbca_s21.303_1_c.text: their residential address, if their address for service has not been provided to the corporation;

cbca_s21.303_1_d.label: (d)
cbca_s21.303_1_d.text: the information referred to in paragraphs 21.1(1)(c) and (d); and

cbca_s21.303_2.title: Exception
cbca_s21.303_2.text: Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of an individual who is less than 18 years of age or an individual to whom prescribed circumstances apply.

cbca_s21.303_3.title: Exemption on application
cbca_s21.303_3.text: If an individual with significant control or the corporation over which they have significant control applies to the Director to have any information referred to in subsection (1) in relation to the individual not made available to the public, the Director may choose to not make it available to the public, subject to any terms that the Director thinks fit,

cbca_s21.303_3_a.label: (a)
cbca_s21.303_3_a.text: if the Director reasonably believes that making it available presents or would present a serious threat to the safety of the individual; or

cbca_s21.303_3_b.label: (b)
cbca_s21.303_3_b.text: if the Director is satisfied that

cbca_s21.303_3_b_ii.label: (ii)
cbca_s21.303_3_b_ii.text: the information is to be kept confidential under subsection 27(8) of the Conflict of Interest Act or a similar provision of an Act of the legislature of a province, or

cbca_s21.303_3_b_iii.label: (iii)
cbca_s21.303_3_b_iii.text: prescribed circumstances apply to the individual.

cbca_s21.31_1.text: On request by an investigative body referred to in subsection (2), a corporation to which section 21.1 applies shall, as soon as feasible after the request is served on the corporation or deemed to be received by it, and in the manner specified by the investigative body,

cbca_s21.31_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s21.31_1_a.text: provide the investigative body with a copy of the corporation’s register of individuals with significant control; or

cbca_s21.31_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s21.31_1_b.text: disclose to the investigative body any information specified by the investigative body that is in the corporation’s register of individuals with significant control.

cbca_s21.31_2.title: Investigative bodies
cbca_s21.31_2.text: The investigative bodies for the purpose of this section are

cbca_s21.31_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s21.31_2_b.text: the Canada Revenue Agency and any provincial body that has responsibilities similar to those of the Canada Revenue Agency; and

cbca_s21.31_2_c.label: (c)
cbca_s21.31_2_c.text: any prescribed body that has investigative powers in relation to offences referred to in the schedule.

cbca_s21.31_3.title: Requirement
cbca_s21.31_3.text: An investigative body may make a request only if it has reasonable grounds to suspect that the copy of the register or the specified information would be relevant to investigating an offence referred to in the schedule and it also has reasonable grounds to suspect that

cbca_s21.31_3_a.label: (a)
cbca_s21.31_3_a.text: the corporation that is the subject of the request committed the offence or was used to

cbca_s21.31_3_a_ii.label: (ii)
cbca_s21.31_3_a_ii.text: facilitate the commission of the offence, or

cbca_s21.31_3_a_iii.label: (iii)
cbca_s21.31_3_a_iii.text: protect from detection or punishment a person who has committed the offence;

cbca_s21.31_3_b.label: (b)
cbca_s21.31_3_b.text: an individual with significant control over the corporation that is the subject of the request is also an individual with significant control over a corporation that committed the offence or was used to do anything referred to in any of subparagraphs (a)(i) to (iii); or

cbca_s21.31_3_c.label: (c)
cbca_s21.31_3_c.text: an individual with significant control over the corporation that is the subject of the request is also an individual who, directly or indirectly, influences the affairs of an entity, other than a corporation, that committed the offence or was used to do anything referred to in any of subparagraphs (a)(i) to (iii).

cbca_s21.31_4.title: Service or sending of request
cbca_s21.31_4.text: The request must be served on the corporation by leaving the request at the corporation’s registered office as shown in the last notice filed under section 19 or sent to the corporation by registered mail to that registered office and, if so sent, is deemed to be received at the time it would be delivered in the ordinary course of mail, unless there are reasonable grounds for believing that the corporation did not receive the request at that time or at all.

cbca_s21.31_5.title: Offence
cbca_s21.31_5.text: A corporation that, without reasonable cause, contravenes subsection (1) is guilty of an offence and liable on summary conviction to a fine of not more than $100,000.

cbca_s21.31_6.title: Amendment to schedule
cbca_s21.31_6.text: The Governor in Council may, by order, amend the schedule by adding or deleting a reference to an offence.

cbca_s21.32_1.text: Every investigative body that makes a request under subsection 21.31(1) shall keep a record setting out the following:

cbca_s21.32_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s21.32_1_a.text: the name of the corporation that was the subject of the request;

cbca_s21.32_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s21.32_1_b.text: the reasonable grounds on which the request was based;

cbca_s21.32_1_d.label: (d)
cbca_s21.32_1_d.text: the date the request was served or deemed to have been received;

cbca_s21.32_1_e.label: (e)
cbca_s21.32_1_e.text: information respecting the service or the sending of the request;

cbca_s21.32_1_f.label: (f)
cbca_s21.32_1_f.text: all information received from the corporation in response to the request; and

cbca_s21.32_2.title: Report
cbca_s21.32_2.text: Every investigative body that makes a request under subsection 21.31(1) shall, within 90 days after the end the calendar year in which the request was made, provide the Director with a report setting out the total number of requests made by it in that year and, in the case of the Royal Canadian Mounted Police and the Canada Revenue Agency, the number of requests made in each province.

cbca_s21.32_3.title: Non-application
cbca_s21.32_3.text: Section 251 does not apply in respect of a contravention of subsection (1) or (2).

cbca_s21.4_1.text: Every director or officer of a corporation who knowingly authorizes, permits or acquiesces in the contravention of subsection 21.1(1), 21.21(1) or (2), 21.3(1) or 21.31(1) by that corporation commits an offence, whether or not the corporation has been prosecuted or convicted.

cbca_s21.4_2.title: Offence — recording of false or misleading information
cbca_s21.4_2.text: Every director or officer of a corporation who knowingly records or knowingly authorizes, permits or acquiesces in the recording of false or misleading information in the register of the corporation referred to in subsection 21.1(1) commits an offence.

cbca_s21.4_3.title: Offence — provision of false or misleading information
cbca_s21.4_3.text: Every director or officer of a corporation who knowingly provides or knowingly authorizes, permits or acquiesces in the provision to any person or entity of false or misleading information in relation to the register of the corporation referred to in subsection 21.1(1) commits an offence.

cbca_s21.4_4.title: Offence — subsection 21.1(4)
cbca_s21.4_4.text: Every shareholder who knowingly contravenes subsection 21.1(4) commits an offence.

cbca_s21.4_5.title: Offence
cbca_s21.4_5.text: A person who commits an offence under any of subsections (1) to (4) is liable

cbca_s21.4_5_a.label: (a)
cbca_s21.4_5_a.text: on summary conviction to a fine not exceeding $200,000 or to imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years, or to both; or

cbca_s21.4_5_b.label: (b)
cbca_s21.4_5_b.text: on conviction on indictment, to a fine not exceeding $1,000,000 or to imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years, or to both.

cbca_s22_1.text: All registers and other records required by this Act to be prepared and maintained may be in a bound or loose-leaf form or in a photographic film form, or may be entered or recorded by any system of mechanical or electronic data processing or any other information storage device that is capable of reproducing any required information in intelligible written form within a reasonable time.

cbca_s22_2.title: Precautions
cbca_s22_2.text: A corporation or its agents or mandataries shall take reasonable precautions to

cbca_s22_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s22_2_b.text: prevent falsification of entries in, and

cbca_s22_2_c.label: (c)
cbca_s22_2_c.text: facilitate detection and correction of inaccuracies in

cbca_s22_3.title: Offence
cbca_s22_3.text: A person who, without reasonable cause, contravenes this section is guilty of an offence and liable on summary conviction to a fine not exceeding five thousand dollars or to imprisonment for a term not exceeding six months or to both.

cbca_s23_1.text: A corporation may, but need not, adopt a corporate seal, and may change a corporate seal that is adopted.

cbca_s23_2.title: Validity of unsealed documents
cbca_s23_2.text: A document executed or, in Quebec, signed on behalf of a corporation is not invalid merely because a corporate seal is not affixed to it.

cbca_s24_1.text: Shares of a corporation shall be in registered form and shall be without nominal or par value.

cbca_s24_2.title: Transitional
cbca_s24_2.text: When a body corporate is continued under this Act, a share with nominal or par value issued by the body corporate before it was so continued is, for the purpose of subsection (1), deemed to be a share without nominal or par value.

cbca_s24_3.title: Rights attached to shares
cbca_s24_3.text: Where a corporation has only one class of shares, the rights of the holders thereof are equal in all respects and include the rights

cbca_s24_3_a.label: (a)
cbca_s24_3_a.text: to vote at any meeting of shareholders of the corporation;

cbca_s24_3_b.label: (b)
cbca_s24_3_b.text: to receive any dividend declared by the corporation; and

cbca_s24_3_c.label: (c)
cbca_s24_3_c.text: to receive the remaining property of the corporation on dissolution.

cbca_s24_4.title: Rights to classes of shares
cbca_s24_4.text: The articles may provide for more than one class of shares and, if they so provide,

cbca_s24_4_a.label: (a)
cbca_s24_4_a.text: the rights, privileges, restrictions and conditions attaching to the shares of each class shall be set out therein; and

cbca_s24_4_b.label: (b)
cbca_s24_4_b.text: the rights set out in subsection (3) shall be attached to at least one class of shares but all such rights are not required to be attached to one class.

cbca_s25_1.text: Subject to the articles, the by-laws and any unanimous shareholder agreement and to section 28, shares may be issued at such times and to such persons and for such consideration as the directors may determine.

cbca_s25_2.title: Shares non-assessable
cbca_s25_2.text: Shares issued by a corporation are non-assessable and the holders are not liable to the corporation or to its creditors in respect thereof.

cbca_s25_3.title: Consideration
cbca_s25_3.text: A share shall not be issued until the consideration for the share is fully paid in money or in property or past services that are not less in value than the fair equivalent of the money that the corporation would have received if the share had been issued for money.

cbca_s25_4.title: Consideration other than money
cbca_s25_4.text: In determining whether property or past services are the fair equivalent of a money consideration, the directors may take into account reasonable charges and expenses of organization and reorganization and payments for property and past services reasonably expected to benefit the corporation.

cbca_s25_5.title: Definition of property
cbca_s25_5.text: For the purposes of this section, property does not include a promissory note, or a promise to pay, that is made by a person to whom a share is issued, or a person who does not deal at arm’s length, within the meaning of that expression in the Income Tax Act, with a person to whom a share is issued.

cbca_s26_1.text: A corporation shall maintain a separate stated capital account for each class and series of shares it issues.

cbca_s26_2.title: Entries in stated capital account
cbca_s26_2.text: A corporation shall add to the appropriate stated capital account the full amount of any consideration it receives for any shares it issues.

cbca_s26_3.title: Exception for non-arm’s length transactions
cbca_s26_3.text: Despite subsection (2), a corporation may, subject to subsection (4), add to the stated capital accounts maintained for the shares of classes or series the whole or any part of the amount of the consideration that it receives in an exchange if the corporation issues shares

cbca_s26_3_a_i.label: (i)
cbca_s26_3_a_i.text: property of a person who immediately before the exchange did not deal with the corporation at arm’s length within the meaning of that expression in the Income Tax Act,

cbca_s26_3_a_ii.label: (ii)
cbca_s26_3_a_ii.text: shares of, or another interest or right in, a body corporate that immediately before the exchange, or that because of the exchange, did not deal with the corporation at arm’s length within the meaning of that expression in the Income Tax Act, or

cbca_s26_3_a_iii.label: (iii)
cbca_s26_3_a_iii.text: property of a person who, immediately before the exchange, dealt with the corporation at arm’s length within the meaning of that expression in the Income Tax Act, if the person, the corporation and all the holders of shares in the class or series of shares so issued consent to the exchange; or

cbca_s26_3_b.label: (b)
cbca_s26_3_b.text: pursuant to an agreement referred to in subsection 182(1) or an arrangement referred to in paragraph 192(1)(b) or (c) or to shareholders of an amalgamating body corporate who receive the shares in addition to or instead of securities of the amalgamated body corporate.

cbca_s26_4.title: Limit on addition to a stated capital account
cbca_s26_4.text: On the issue of a share a corporation shall not add to a stated capital account in respect of the share it issues an amount greater than the amount of the consideration it received for the share.

cbca_s26_5.title: Constraint on addition to a stated capital account
cbca_s26_5.text: Where a corporation proposes to add any amount to a stated capital account it maintains in respect of a class or series of shares, if

cbca_s26_5_a.label: (a)
cbca_s26_5_a.text: the amount to be added was not received by the corporation as consideration for the issue of shares, and

cbca_s26_5_b.label: (b)
cbca_s26_5_b.text: the corporation has issued any outstanding shares of more than one class or series,

cbca_s26_6.title: Other additions to stated capital
cbca_s26_6.text: When a body corporate is continued under this Act, it may add to a stated capital account any consideration received by it for a share it issued and a corporation at any time may, subject to subsection (5), add to a stated capital account any amount it credited to a retained earnings or other surplus account.

cbca_s26_7.title: Transitional
cbca_s26_7.text: When a body corporate is continued under this Act, subsection (2) does not apply to the consideration received by it before it was so continued unless the share in respect of which the consideration is received is issued after the corporation is so continued.

cbca_s26_8.title: Idem
cbca_s26_8.text: When a body corporate is continued under this Act, any amount unpaid in respect of a share issued by the body corporate before it was so continued and paid after it was so continued shall be added to the stated capital account maintained for the shares of that class or series.

cbca_s26_9.title: Transitional
cbca_s26_9.text: For the purposes of subsection 34(2), sections 38 and 42, and paragraph 185(2)(a), when a body corporate is continued under this Act its stated capital is deemed to include the amount that would have been included in stated capital if the body corporate had been incorporated under this Act.

cbca_s26_10.title: Restriction
cbca_s26_10.text: A corporation shall not reduce its stated capital or any stated capital account except in the manner provided in this Act.

cbca_s26_11.title: Exception for an open-end mutual fund
cbca_s26_11.text: Subsections (1) to (10) and any other provisions of this Act relating to stated capital do not apply to an open-end mutual fund.

cbca_s26_12.title: Definition of open-end mutual fund
cbca_s26_12.text: For the purposes of this section, open-end mutual fund means a distributing corporation that carries on only the business of investing the consideration it receives for the shares it issues, and all or substantially all of those shares are redeemable on the demand of a shareholder.

cbca_s27_1.text: The articles may authorize, subject to any limitations set out in them, the issue of any class of shares in one or more series and may do either or both of the following:

cbca_s27_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s27_1_a.text: fix the number of shares in, and determine the designation, rights, privileges, restrictions and conditions attaching to the shares of, each series; or

cbca_s27_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s27_1_b.text: authorize the directors to fix the number of shares in, and determine the designation, rights, privileges, restrictions and conditions attaching to the shares of, each series.

cbca_s27_2.title: Series participation
cbca_s27_2.text: If any cumulative dividends or amounts payable on return of capital in respect of a series of shares are not paid in full, the shares of all series of the same class participate rateably in respect of accumulated dividends and return of capital.

cbca_s27_3.title: Restrictions on series
cbca_s27_3.text: No rights, privileges, restrictions or conditions attached to a series of shares authorized under this section shall confer on a series a priority in respect of dividends or return of capital over any other series of shares of the same class that are then outstanding.

cbca_s27_4.title: Amendment of articles
cbca_s27_4.text: If the directors exercise their authority under paragraph (1)(b), they shall, before the issue of shares of the series, send, in the form that the Director fixes, articles of amendment to the Director to designate a series of shares.

cbca_s27_5.title: Certificate of amendment
cbca_s27_5.text: On receipt of articles of amendment designating a series of shares, the Director shall issue a certificate of amendment in accordance with section 262.

cbca_s27_6.title: Effect of certificate
cbca_s27_6.text: The articles of the corporation are amended accordingly on the date shown in the certificate of amendment.

cbca_s28_1.text: If the articles so provide, no shares of a class shall be issued unless the shares have first been offered to the shareholders holding shares of that class, and those shareholders have a pre-emptive right to acquire the offered shares in proportion to their holdings of the shares of that class, at such price and on such terms as those shares are to be offered to others.

cbca_s28_2.title: Exception
cbca_s28_2.text: Notwithstanding that the articles provide the pre-emptive right referred to in subsection (1), shareholders have no pre-emptive right in respect of shares to be issued

cbca_s28_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s28_2_a.text: for a consideration other than money;

cbca_s28_2_c.label: (c)
cbca_s28_2_c.text: pursuant to the exercise of conversion privileges, options or rights previously granted by the corporation.

cbca_s29_1.text: A corporation may issue certificates, warrants or other evidences of conversion privileges, options or rights to acquire securities of the corporation, and shall set out the conditions thereof

cbca_s29_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s29_1_a.text: in the certificates, warrants or other evidences; or

cbca_s29_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s29_1_b.text: in certificates evidencing the securities to which the conversion privileges, options or rights are attached.

cbca_s29_2.title: Transferable rights
cbca_s29_2.text: Conversion privileges, options and rights to acquire securities of a corporation may be made transferable or non-transferable, and options and rights to acquire may be made separable or inseparable from any securities to which they are attached.

cbca_s29_3.title: Reserved shares
cbca_s29_3.text: Where a corporation has granted privileges to convert any securities issued by the corporation into shares, or into shares of another class or series, or has issued or granted options or rights to acquire shares, if the articles limit the number of authorized shares, the corporation shall reserve and continue to reserve sufficient authorized shares to meet the exercise of such conversion privileges, options and rights.

cbca_s29.1_1.text: Despite section 29, a corporation shall not issue, in bearer form, a certificate, warrant or other evidence of a conversion privilege, option or right to acquire a share of the corporation.

cbca_s29.1_2.title: Replacement
cbca_s29.1_2.text: A corporation shall, on the request of a holder of a certificate, warrant or other evidence of a conversion privilege, option or right to acquire a share of the corporation that is in bearer form and that was issued before the coming into force of this section, issue in exchange to that holder, in registered form, a certificate, warrant or other evidence, as the case may be.

cbca_s30_1.text: Subject to subsection (2) and sections 31 to 36, a corporation

cbca_s30_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s30_1_a.text: shall not hold shares in itself or in its holding body corporate; and

cbca_s30_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s30_1_b.text: shall not permit any of its subsidiary bodies corporate to acquire shares of the corporation.

cbca_s30_2.title: Subsidiary holding shares of its parent
cbca_s30_2.text: Subject to section 31, a corporation shall cause a subsidiary body corporate of the corporation that holds shares of the corporation to sell or otherwise dispose of those shares within five years from the date

cbca_s30_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s30_2_a.text: the body corporate became a subsidiary of the corporation; or

cbca_s30_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s30_2_b.text: the corporation was continued under this Act.

cbca_s31_1.text: A corporation may in the capacity of a personal representative hold shares in itself or in its holding body corporate unless it or the holding body corporate or a subsidiary of either of them has a beneficial interest in the shares.

cbca_s31_2.title: Idem
cbca_s31_2.text: A corporation may hold shares in itself or in its holding body corporate by way of security for the purposes of a transaction entered into by it in the ordinary course of a business that includes the lending of money.

cbca_s31_3.title: Exception — subsidiary acquiring shares
cbca_s31_3.text: A corporation may permit any of its subsidiary bodies corporate to acquire shares of the corporation

cbca_s31_3_a.label: (a)
cbca_s31_3_a.text: in the subsidiary’s capacity as a personal representative, unless the subsidiary would have a beneficial interest in the shares; or

cbca_s31_3_b.label: (b)
cbca_s31_3_b.text: by way of security for the purposes of a transaction entered into by the subsidiary in the ordinary course of a business that includes the lending of money.

cbca_s31_4.title: Exception — conditions precedent
cbca_s31_4.text: A corporation may permit any of its subsidiary bodies corporate to acquire shares of the corporation through the issuance of those shares by the corporation to the subsidiary body corporate if, before the acquisition takes place, the conditions prescribed for the purposes of this subsection are met.

cbca_s31_5.title: Conditions subsequent
cbca_s31_5.text: After an acquisition has taken place under the purported authority of subsection (4), the conditions prescribed for the purposes of this subsection must be met.

cbca_s31_6_a.label: (a)
cbca_s31_6_a.text: a corporation permits a subsidiary body corporate to acquire shares of the corporation under the purported authority of subsection (4), and

cbca_s31_6_b_i.label: (i)
cbca_s31_6_b_i.text: one or more of the conditions prescribed for the purposes of subsection (4) were not met, or

cbca_s31_6_b_ii.label: (ii)
cbca_s31_6_b_ii.text: one or more of the conditions prescribed for the purposes of subsection (5) are not met or cease to be met,

cbca_s32_1.text: Subject to subsection 39(8), a corporation may, for the purpose of assisting the corporation or any of its affiliates or associates to qualify under any prescribed law of Canada or a province to receive licences, permits, grants, payments or other benefits by reason of attaining or maintaining a specified level of Canadian ownership or control, hold shares in itself that

cbca_s32_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s32_1_a.text: are not constrained for the purpose of assisting the corporation or any of its affiliates or associates to so qualify; or

cbca_s32_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s32_1_b.text: are shares into which shares held under paragraph (a) were converted by the corporation that are constrained for the purpose of assisting the corporation to so qualify and that were not previously held by the corporation.

cbca_s32_2.title: Prohibited transfers
cbca_s32_2.text: A corporation shall not transfer shares held under subsection (1) to any person unless the corporation is satisfied, on reasonable grounds, that the ownership of the shares as a result of the transfer would assist the corporation or any of its affiliates or associates to achieve the purpose set out in subsection (1).

cbca_s32_3.title: Offence
cbca_s32_3.text: A corporation that, without reasonable cause, fails to comply with subsection (2) is guilty of an offence and liable on summary conviction to a fine not exceeding five thousand dollars.

cbca_s32_4.title: Directors of corporation
cbca_s32_4.text: Where a corporation commits an offence under subsection (3), any director of the corporation who knowingly authorized, permitted or acquiesced in the commission of the offence is a party to and guilty of the offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine not exceeding five thousand dollars or to imprisonment for a term not exceeding six months or to both, whether or not the corporation has been prosecuted or convicted.

cbca_s32_5.title: Where shares are transferred
cbca_s32_5.text: Where shares held under subsection (1) are transferred by a corporation, subsections 25(1), (3), (4) and (5), paragraph 115(3)(c) and subsection 118(1) apply, with such modifications as the circumstances require, in respect of the transfer as if the transfer were an issue.

cbca_s32_6.title: Transfer not void, voidable or null
cbca_s32_6.text: No transfer of shares by a corporation shall be void, voidable or, in Quebec, null solely because the transfer is in contravention of subsection (2).

cbca_s33_1.text: A corporation holding shares in itself or in its holding body corporate shall not vote or permit those shares to be voted unless the corporation

cbca_s33_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s33_1_a.text: holds the shares in the capacity of a personal representative; and

cbca_s33_2.title: Subsidiary body corporate
cbca_s33_2.text: A corporation shall not permit any of its subsidiary bodies corporate holding shares in the corporation to vote, or permit those shares to be voted, unless the subsidiary body corporate satisfies the requirements of subsection (1).

cbca_s34_1.text: Subject to subsection (2) and to its articles, a corporation may purchase or otherwise acquire shares issued by it.

cbca_s34_2.title: Limitation
cbca_s34_2.text: A corporation shall not make any payment to purchase or otherwise acquire shares issued by it if there are reasonable grounds for believing that

cbca_s34_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s34_2_a.text: the corporation is, or would after the payment be, unable to pay its liabilities as they become due; or

cbca_s34_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s34_2_b.text: the realizable value of the corporation’s assets would after the payment be less than the aggregate of its liabilities and stated capital of all classes.

cbca_s35.title: Alternative acquisition of corporation’s own shares

cbca_s35_1.text: Notwithstanding subsection 34(2), but subject to subsection (3) and to its articles, a corporation may purchase or otherwise acquire shares issued by it to

cbca_s35_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s35_1_a.text: settle or compromise a debt or claim asserted by or against the corporation;

cbca_s35_1_c.label: (c)
cbca_s35_1_c.text: fulfil the terms of a non-assignable agreement under which the corporation has an option or is obliged to purchase shares owned by a director, an officer or an employee of the corporation.

cbca_s35_2.title: Idem
cbca_s35_2.text: Notwithstanding subsection 34(2), a corporation may purchase or otherwise acquire shares issued by it to

cbca_s35_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s35_2_a.text: satisfy the claim of a shareholder who dissents under section 190; or

cbca_s35_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s35_2_b.text: comply with an order under section 241.

cbca_s35_3.title: Limitation
cbca_s35_3.text: A corporation shall not make any payment to purchase or acquire under subsection (1) shares issued by it if there are reasonable grounds for believing that

cbca_s35_3_a.label: (a)
cbca_s35_3_a.text: the corporation is, or would after the payment be, unable to pay its liabilities as they become due; or

cbca_s35_3_b.label: (b)
cbca_s35_3_b.text: the realizable value of the corporation’s assets would after the payment be less than the aggregate of

cbca_s35_3_b_ii.label: (ii)
cbca_s35_3_b_ii.text: the amount required for payment on a redemption or in a liquidation of all shares the holders of which have the right to be paid before the holders of the shares to be purchased or acquired, to the extent that the amount has not been included in its liabilities.

cbca_s36_1.text: Notwithstanding subsection 34(2) or 35(3), but subject to subsection (2) and to its articles, a corporation may purchase or redeem any redeemable shares issued by it at prices not exceeding the redemption price thereof stated in the articles or calculated according to a formula stated in the articles.

cbca_s36_2.title: Limitation
cbca_s36_2.text: A corporation shall not make any payment to purchase or redeem any redeemable shares issued by it if there are reasonable grounds for believing that

cbca_s36_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s36_2_a.text: the corporation is, or would after the payment be, unable to pay its liabilities as they become due; or

cbca_s36_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s36_2_b.text: the realizable value of the corporation’s assets would after the payment be less than the aggregate of

cbca_s36_2_b_ii.label: (ii)
cbca_s36_2_b_ii.text: the amount that would be required to pay the holders of shares that have a right to be paid, on a redemption or in a liquidation, rateably with or before the holders of the shares to be purchased or redeemed, to the extent that the amount has not been included in its liabilities.

cbca_s37.title: Gift or legacy of shares
cbca_s37.text: A corporation may accept from any shareholder a share of the corporation surrendered to it as a gift including, in Quebec, a legacy but may not extinguish or reduce a liability in respect of an amount unpaid on any such share except in accordance with section 38.

cbca_s38_1.text: Subject to subsection (3), a corporation may by special resolution reduce its stated capital for any purpose including, without limiting the generality of the foregoing, for the purpose of

cbca_s38_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s38_1_a.text: extinguishing or reducing a liability in respect of an amount unpaid on any share;

cbca_s38_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s38_1_b.text: distributing to the holder of an issued share of any class or series of shares an amount not exceeding the stated capital of the class or series; and

cbca_s38_1_c.label: (c)
cbca_s38_1_c.text: declaring its stated capital to be reduced by an amount that is not represented by realizable assets.

cbca_s38_2.title: Contents of special resolution
cbca_s38_2.text: A special resolution under this section shall specify the stated capital account or accounts from which the reduction of stated capital effected by the special resolution will be deducted.

cbca_s38_3.title: Limitation
cbca_s38_3.text: A corporation shall not reduce its stated capital for any purpose other than the purpose mentioned in paragraph (1)(c) if there are reasonable grounds for believing that

cbca_s38_3_a.label: (a)
cbca_s38_3_a.text: the corporation is, or would after the reduction be, unable to pay its liabilities as they become due; or

cbca_s38_3_b.label: (b)
cbca_s38_3_b.text: the realizable value of the corporation’s assets would thereby be less than the aggregate of its liabilities.

cbca_s38_4.title: Recovery
cbca_s38_4.text: A creditor of a corporation is entitled to apply to a court for an order compelling a shareholder or other recipient

cbca_s38_4_a.label: (a)
cbca_s38_4_a.text: to pay to the corporation an amount equal to any liability of the shareholder that was extinguished or reduced contrary to this section; or

cbca_s38_4_b.label: (b)
cbca_s38_4_b.text: to pay or deliver to the corporation any money or property that was paid or distributed to the shareholder or other recipient as a consequence of a reduction of capital made contrary to this section.

cbca_s38_5.title: Limitation
cbca_s38_5.text: An action to enforce a liability imposed by this section may not be commenced after two years from the date of the act complained of.

cbca_s39_1.text: On a purchase, redemption or other acquisition by a corporation under section 34, 35, 36, 45 or 190 or paragraph 241(3)(f), of shares or fractions thereof issued by it, the corporation shall deduct from the stated capital account maintained for the class or series of shares of which the shares purchased, redeemed or otherwise acquired form a part an amount equal to the result obtained by multiplying the stated capital of the shares of that class or series by the number of shares of that class or series or fractions thereof purchased, redeemed or otherwise acquired, divided by the number of issued shares of that class or series immediately before the purchase, redemption or other acquisition.

cbca_s39_2.title: Idem
cbca_s39_2.text: A corporation shall deduct the amount of a payment made by the corporation to a shareholder under paragraph 241(3)(g) from the stated capital account maintained for the class or series of shares in respect of which the payment was made.

cbca_s39_3.title: Idem
cbca_s39_3.text: A corporation shall adjust its stated capital account or accounts in accordance with any special resolution referred to in subsection 38(2).

cbca_s39_4.title: Idem
cbca_s39_4.text: On a conversion of issued shares of a corporation into shares of another class or series or a change under section 173, 191 or 241 of issued shares of a corporation into shares of another class or series, the corporation shall

cbca_s39_4_a.label: (a)
cbca_s39_4_a.text: deduct from the stated capital account maintained for the class or series of shares converted or changed an amount equal to the result obtained by multiplying the stated capital of the shares of that class or series by the number of shares of that class or series converted or changed, divided by the number of issued shares of that class or series immediately before the conversion or change; and

cbca_s39_4_b.label: (b)
cbca_s39_4_b.text: add the result obtained under paragraph (a) and any additional consideration received pursuant to the conversion or change to the stated capital account maintained or to be maintained for the class or series of shares into which the shares have been converted or changed.

cbca_s39_5.title: Stated capital of interconvertible shares
cbca_s39_5.text: For the purposes of subsection (4) and subject to its articles, where a corporation issues two classes of shares and there is attached to each such class a right to convert a share of the one class into a share of the other class, if a share of one class is converted into a share of the other class, the amount of stated capital attributable to a share in either class is the aggregate of the stated capital of both classes divided by the number of issued shares of both classes immediately before the conversion.

cbca_s39_6.title: Cancellation or restoration of shares
cbca_s39_6.text: Shares or fractions thereof of any class or series of shares issued by a corporation and purchased, redeemed or otherwise acquired by it shall be cancelled or, if the articles limit the number of authorized shares, may be restored to the status of authorized but unissued shares of the class.

cbca_s39_7.title: Exception
cbca_s39_7.text: For the purposes of this section, a corporation holding shares in itself as permitted by subsections 31(1) and (2) is deemed not to have purchased, redeemed or otherwise acquired such shares.

cbca_s39_8.title: Idem
cbca_s39_8.text: For the purposes of this section, a corporation holding shares in itself as permitted by paragraph 32(1)(a) is deemed not to have purchased, redeemed or otherwise acquired the shares at the time they were acquired, but

cbca_s39_8_a.label: (a)
cbca_s39_8_a.text: any of those shares that are held by the corporation at the expiration of two years, and

cbca_s39_8_b.label: (b)
cbca_s39_8_b.text: any shares into which any of those shares were converted by the corporation and held under paragraph 32(1)(b) that are held by the corporation at the expiration of two years after the shares from which they were converted were acquired

cbca_s39_9.title: Conversion or change of shares
cbca_s39_9.text: Shares issued by a corporation and converted into shares of another class or series or changed under section 173, 191 or 241 into shares of another class or series shall become issued shares of the class or series of shares into which the shares have been converted or changed.

cbca_s39_10.title: Effect of change of shares on number of unissued shares
cbca_s39_10.text: Where the articles limit the number of authorized shares of a class of shares of a corporation and issued shares of that class or of a series of shares of that class have become, pursuant to subsection (9), issued shares of another class or series, the number of unissued shares of the first-mentioned class shall, unless the articles otherwise provide, be increased by the number of shares that, pursuant to subsection (9), became shares of another class or series.

cbca_s39_11.title: Repayment
cbca_s39_11.text: Debt obligations issued, pledged, hypothecated or deposited by a corporation are not redeemed by reason only that the indebtedness evidenced by the debt obligations or in respect of which the debt obligations are issued, pledged, hypothecated or deposited is repaid.

cbca_s39_12.title: Acquisition and reissue of debt obligations
cbca_s39_12.text: Debt obligations issued by a corporation and purchased, redeemed or otherwise acquired by it may be cancelled or, subject to any applicable trust indenture or other agreement, may be reissued, pledged or hypothecated to secure any obligation of the corporation then existing or thereafter incurred, and any such acquisition and reissue, pledge or hypothecation is not a cancellation of the debt obligations.

cbca_s40.title: Enforcement of contract to buy shares

cbca_s40_1.text: A corporation shall fulfil its obligations under a contract to buy shares of the corporation, except if the corporation can prove that enforcement of the contract would put it in breach of any of sections 34 to 36.

cbca_s40_2.title: Status of contracting party
cbca_s40_2.text: Until the corporation has fulfilled all its obligations under a contract referred to in subsection (1), the other party retains the status of claimant entitled to be paid as soon as the corporation is lawfully able to do so or, in a liquidation, to be ranked subordinate to the rights of creditors and to the rights of holders of any class of shares whose rights were in priority to the rights given to the holders of the class of shares being purchased, but in priority to the rights of other shareholders.

cbca_s41.title: Commission for sale of shares
cbca_s41.text: The directors may authorize the corporation to pay a reasonable commission to any person in consideration of the person’s purchasing or agreeing to purchase shares of the corporation from the corporation or from any other person, or procuring or agreeing to procure purchasers for any such shares.

cbca_s42.title: Dividends
cbca_s42.text: A corporation shall not declare or pay a dividend if there are reasonable grounds for believing that

cbca_s42_a.label: (a)
cbca_s42_a.text: the corporation is, or would after the payment be, unable to pay its liabilities as they become due; or

cbca_s42_b.label: (b)
cbca_s42_b.text: the realizable value of the corporation’s assets would thereby be less than the aggregate of its liabilities and stated capital of all classes.

cbca_s43_1.text: A corporation may pay a dividend by issuing fully paid shares of the corporation and, subject to section 42, a corporation may pay a dividend in money or property.

cbca_s43_2.title: Adjustment of stated capital account
cbca_s43_2.text: If shares of a corporation are issued in payment of a dividend, the declared amount of the dividend stated as an amount of money shall be added to the stated capital account maintained or to be maintained for the shares of the class or series issued in payment of the dividend.

cbca_s45_1.text: The shareholders of a corporation are not, as shareholders, liable for any liability, act or default of the corporation except under subsection 38(4), 118(4) or (5), 146(5) or 226(4) or (5).

cbca_s45_2.title: Lien or hypothec on shares
cbca_s45_2.text: Subject to subsection 49(8), the articles may provide that the corporation has a lien or hypothec on a share registered in the name of a shareholder or the shareholder’s personal representative for a debt of that shareholder to the corporation, including an amount unpaid in respect of a share issued by a body corporate on the date it was continued under this Act.

cbca_s45_3.title: Enforcement of lien or hypothec
cbca_s45_3.text: A corporation may enforce a lien or hypothec referred to in subsection (2) in accordance with its by-laws.

cbca_s46.title: Sale of constrained shares by corporation

cbca_s46_1.text: A corporation that has constraints on the issue, transfer or ownership of its shares of any class or series may, for any of the purposes referred to in paragraphs (a) to (c), sell, under the conditions and after giving the notice that may be prescribed, as if it were the owner of the shares, any of those constrained shares that are owned, or that the directors determine in the manner that may be prescribed may be owned, contrary to the constraints in order to

cbca_s46_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s46_1_a.text: assist the corporation or any of its affiliates or associates to qualify under any prescribed law of Canada or a province to receive licences, permits, grants, payments or other benefits by reason of attaining or maintaining a specified level of Canadian ownership or control;

cbca_s46_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s46_1_b.text: assist the corporation to comply with any prescribed law; or

cbca_s46_1_c.label: (c)
cbca_s46_1_c.text: attain or maintain a level of Canadian ownership specified in its articles.

cbca_s46_2.title: Obligations of directors in sale
