cbca_s106_8.title: Appointment of directors
cbca_s106_8.text: The directors may, unless the articles otherwise provide, appoint one or more additional directors, who shall hold office for a term ending not later than the close of the next annual meeting of shareholders, but the total number of directors so appointed shall not exceed one third of the number of directors elected at the previous annual meeting of shareholders.

cbca_s106_8.1.title: Exception
cbca_s106_8.1.text: If an individual who was a candidate in an election held in accordance with subsection (3.4) was not elected during that election, the individual is not to be appointed, except in prescribed circumstances, as a director under subsection (8) or 111(1) before the next meeting of shareholders at which an election of directors is required.

cbca_s106_9.title: Election or appointment as director
cbca_s106_9.text: An individual who is elected or appointed to hold office as a director is not a director and is deemed not to have been elected or appointed to hold office as a director unless

cbca_s106_9_a.label: (a)
cbca_s106_9_a.text: he or she was present at the meeting when the election or appointment took place and he or she did not refuse to hold office as a director; or

cbca_s106_9_b.label: (b)
cbca_s106_9_b.text: he or she was not present at the meeting when the election or appointment took place and

cbca_s106_9_b_i.label: (i)
cbca_s106_9_b_i.text: he or she consented to hold office as a director in writing before the election or appointment or within ten days after it, or

cbca_s106_9_b_ii.label: (ii)
cbca_s106_9_b_ii.text: he or she has acted as a director pursuant to the election or appointment.

cbca_s107.title: Cumulative voting
cbca_s107.text: Where the articles provide for cumulative voting,

cbca_s107_a.label: (a)
cbca_s107_a.text: the articles shall require a fixed number and not a minimum and maximum number of directors;

cbca_s107_b.label: (b)
cbca_s107_b.text: each shareholder entitled to vote at an election of directors has the right to cast a number of votes equal to the number of votes attached to the shares held by the shareholder multiplied by the number of directors to be elected, and may cast all of those votes in favour of one candidate or distribute them among the candidates in any manner;

cbca_s107_c.label: (c)
cbca_s107_c.text: a separate vote of shareholders shall be taken with respect to each candidate nominated for director unless a resolution is passed unanimously permitting two or more persons to be elected by a single resolution;

cbca_s107_d.label: (d)
cbca_s107_d.text: if a shareholder has voted for more than one candidate without specifying the distribution of votes, the shareholder is deemed to have distributed the votes equally among those candidates;

cbca_s107_e.label: (e)
cbca_s107_e.text: if the number of candidates nominated for director exceeds the number of positions to be filled, the candidates who receive the least number of votes shall be eliminated until the number of candidates remaining equals the number of positions to be filled;

cbca_s107_f.label: (f)
cbca_s107_f.text: each director ceases to hold office at the close of the first annual meeting of shareholders following the director’s election;

cbca_s107_g.label: (g)
cbca_s107_g.text: a director may be removed from office only if the number of votes cast in favour of the director’s removal is greater than the product of the number of directors required by the articles and the number of votes cast against the motion; and

cbca_s107_h.label: (h)
cbca_s107_h.text: the number of directors required by the articles may be decreased only if the votes cast in favour of the motion to decrease the number of directors is greater than the product of the number of directors required by the articles and the number of votes cast against the motion.

cbca_s108_1.text: A director of a corporation ceases to hold office when the director

cbca_s108_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s108_1_b.text: is removed in accordance with section 109; or

cbca_s108_2.title: Effective date of resignation
cbca_s108_2.text: A resignation of a director becomes effective at the time a written resignation is sent to the corporation, or at the time specified in the resignation, whichever is later.

cbca_s109_1.text: Subject to paragraph 107(g), the shareholders of a corporation may by ordinary resolution at a special meeting remove any director or directors from office.

cbca_s109_2.title: Exception
cbca_s109_2.text: Where the holders of any class or series of shares of a corporation have an exclusive right to elect one or more directors, a director so elected may only be removed by an ordinary resolution at a meeting of the shareholders of that class or series.

cbca_s109_3.title: Vacancy
cbca_s109_3.text: Subject to paragraphs 107(b) to (e), a vacancy created by the removal of a director may be filled at the meeting of the shareholders at which the director is removed or, if not so filled, may be filled under section 111.

cbca_s109_4.title: Resignation (or removal)
cbca_s109_4.text: If all of the directors have resigned or have been removed without replacement, a person who manages or supervises the management of the business and affairs of the corporation is deemed to be a director for the purposes of this Act.

cbca_s109_5_a.label: (a)
cbca_s109_5_a.text: an officer who manages the business or affairs of the corporation under the direction or control of a shareholder or other person;

cbca_s109_5_b.label: (b)
cbca_s109_5_b.text: a lawyer, notary, accountant or other professional who participates in the management of the corporation solely for the purpose of providing professional services; or

cbca_s109_5_c.label: (c)
cbca_s109_5_c.text: a trustee in bankruptcy, receiver, receiver-manager, sequestrator or secured creditor who participates in the management of the corporation or exercises control over its property solely for the purpose of the realization of security or the administration of a bankrupt’s estate, in the case of a trustee in bankruptcy.

cbca_s110_1.text: A director of a corporation is entitled to receive notice of and to attend and be heard at every meeting of shareholders.

cbca_s110_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s110_2_b.text: receives a notice or otherwise learns of a meeting of shareholders called for the purpose of removing the director from office, or

cbca_s110_2_c.label: (c)
cbca_s110_2_c.text: receives a notice or otherwise learns of a meeting of directors or shareholders at which another person is to be appointed or elected to fill the office of director, whether because of the director’s resignation or removal or because the director’s term of office has expired or is about to expire,

cbca_s110_3.title: Circulating statement
cbca_s110_3.text: A corporation shall forthwith send a copy of the statement referred to in subsection (2) to every shareholder entitled to receive notice of any meeting referred to in subsection (1) and to the Director unless the statement is included in or attached to a management proxy circular required by section 150.

cbca_s110_4.title: Immunity
cbca_s110_4.text: No corporation or person acting on its behalf incurs any liability by reason only of circulating a director’s statement in compliance with subsection (3).

cbca_s111_1.text: Despite subsection 114(3), but subject to subsections (3) and (4), a quorum of directors may fill a vacancy among the directors, except a vacancy resulting from an increase in the number or the minimum or maximum number of directors or a failure to elect the number or minimum number of directors provided for in the articles.

cbca_s111_2.title: Calling meeting
cbca_s111_2.text: If there is not a quorum of directors or if there has been a failure to elect the number or minimum number of directors provided for in the articles, the directors then in office shall without delay call a special meeting of shareholders to fill the vacancy and, if they fail to call a meeting or if there are no directors then in office, the meeting may be called by any shareholder.

cbca_s111_3.title: Class director
cbca_s111_3.text: If the holders of any class or series of shares of a corporation have an exclusive right to elect one or more directors and a vacancy occurs among those directors,

cbca_s111_3_a.label: (a)
cbca_s111_3_a.text: subject to subsection (4), the remaining directors elected by the holders of that class or series of shares may fill the vacancy except a vacancy resulting from an increase in the number or the minimum or maximum number of directors for that class or series or from a failure to elect the number or minimum number of directors provided for in the articles for that class or series; or

cbca_s111_3_b.label: (b)
cbca_s111_3_b.text: if there are no remaining directors any holder of shares of that class or series may call a meeting of the holders of shares of that class or series for the purpose of filling the vacancy.

cbca_s111_4.title: Shareholders filling vacancy
cbca_s111_4.text: The articles may provide that a vacancy among the directors shall only be filled by a vote of the shareholders, or by a vote of the holders of any class or series of shares having an exclusive right to elect one or more directors if the vacancy occurs among the directors elected by that class or series.

cbca_s111_5.title: Unexpired term
cbca_s111_5.text: A director appointed or elected to fill a vacancy holds office for the unexpired term of their predecessor.

cbca_s112_1.text: The shareholders of a corporation may amend the articles to increase or, subject to paragraph 107(h), to decrease the number of directors, or the minimum or maximum number of directors, but no decrease shall shorten the term of an incumbent director.

cbca_s112_2.title: Election of directors where articles amended
cbca_s112_2.text: Where the shareholders at a meeting adopt an amendment to the articles of a corporation to increase or, subject to paragraph 107(h) and to subsection (1), decrease the number or minimum or maximum number of directors, the shareholders may, at the meeting, elect the number of directors authorized by the amendment, and for that purpose, notwithstanding subsections 179(1) and 262(3), on the issue of a certificate of amendment the articles are deemed to be amended as of the date the shareholders adopt the amendment.

cbca_s113.title: Notice of change of director or director’s address

cbca_s113_1.text: A corporation shall, within fifteen days after

cbca_s113_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s113_1_a.text: a change is made among its directors, or

cbca_s113_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s113_1_b.text: it receives a notice of change of address of a director referred to in subsection (1.1),

cbca_s113_1.1.title: Director’s change of address
cbca_s113_1.1.text: A director shall, within fifteen days after changing his or her address, send the corporation a notice of that change.

cbca_s113_2.title: Application to court
cbca_s113_2.text: Any interested person, or the Director, may apply to a court for an order to require a corporation to comply with subsection (1), and the court may so order and make any further order it thinks fit.

cbca_s114_1.text: Unless the articles or by-laws otherwise provide, the directors may meet at any place and on such notice as the by-laws require.

cbca_s114_2.title: Quorum
cbca_s114_2.text: Subject to the articles or by-laws, a majority of the number of directors or minimum number of directors required by the articles constitutes a quorum at any meeting of directors, and, notwithstanding any vacancy among the directors, a quorum of directors may exercise all the powers of the directors.

cbca_s114_3.title: Canadian directors present at meetings
cbca_s114_3.text: Directors, other than directors of a corporation referred to in subsection 105(4), shall not transact business at a meeting of directors unless,

cbca_s114_3_a.label: (a)
cbca_s114_3_a.text: if the corporation is subject to subsection 105(3), at least twenty-five per cent of the directors present are resident Canadians or, if the corporation has less than four directors, at least one of the directors present is a resident Canadian; or

cbca_s114_3_b.label: (b)
cbca_s114_3_b.text: if the corporation is subject to subsection 105(3.1), a majority of directors present are resident Canadians or if the corporation has only two directors, at least one of the directors present is a resident Canadian.

cbca_s114_4.title: Exception
cbca_s114_4.text: Despite subsection (3), directors may transact business at a meeting of directors where the number of resident Canadian directors, required under that subsection, is not present if

cbca_s114_4_a.label: (a)
cbca_s114_4_a.text: a resident Canadian director who is unable to be present approves in writing, or by telephonic, electronic or other communication facility, the business transacted at the meeting; and

cbca_s114_4_b.label: (b)
cbca_s114_4_b.text: the required number of resident Canadian directors would have been present had that director been present at the meeting.

cbca_s114_5.title: Notice of meeting
cbca_s114_5.text: A notice of a meeting of directors shall specify any matter referred to in subsection 115(3) that is to be dealt with at the meeting but, unless the by-laws otherwise provide, need not specify the purpose of or the business to be transacted at the meeting.

cbca_s114_6.title: Waiver of notice
cbca_s114_6.text: A director may in any manner waive a notice of a meeting of directors; and attendance of a director at a meeting of directors is a waiver of notice of the meeting, except where a director attends a meeting for the express purpose of objecting to the transaction of any business on the grounds that the meeting is not lawfully called.

cbca_s114_7.title: Adjournment
cbca_s114_7.text: Notice of an adjourned meeting of directors is not required to be given if the time and place of the adjourned meeting is announced at the original meeting.

cbca_s114_8.title: One director meeting
cbca_s114_8.text: Where a corporation has only one director, that director may constitute a meeting.

cbca_s114_9.title: Participation
cbca_s114_9.text: Subject to the by-laws, a director may, in accordance with the regulations, if any, and if all the directors of the corporation consent, participate in a meeting of directors or of a committee of directors by means of a telephonic, electronic or other communication facility that permits all participants to communicate adequately with each other during the meeting. A director participating in such a meeting by such means is deemed for the purposes of this Act to be present at that meeting.

cbca_s115_1.text: Directors of a corporation may appoint from their number a managing director who is a resident Canadian or a committee of directors and delegate to such managing director or committee any of the powers of the directors.

cbca_s115_3.title: Limits on authority
cbca_s115_3.text: Notwithstanding subsection (1), no managing director and no committee of directors has authority to

cbca_s115_3_a.label: (a)
cbca_s115_3_a.text: submit to the shareholders any question or matter requiring the approval of the shareholders;

cbca_s115_3_b.label: (b)
cbca_s115_3_b.text: fill a vacancy among the directors or in the office of auditor, or appoint additional directors;

cbca_s115_3_c.label: (c)
cbca_s115_3_c.text: issue securities except as authorized by the directors;

cbca_s115_3_c.1.label: (c.1)
cbca_s115_3_c.1.text: issue shares of a series under section 27 except as authorized by the directors;

cbca_s115_3_e.label: (e)
cbca_s115_3_e.text: purchase, redeem or otherwise acquire shares issued by the corporation;

cbca_s115_3_f.label: (f)
cbca_s115_3_f.text: pay a commission referred to in section 41 except as authorized by the directors;

cbca_s115_3_g.label: (g)
cbca_s115_3_g.text: approve a management proxy circular referred to in Part XIII;

cbca_s115_3_h.label: (h)
cbca_s115_3_h.text: approve a take-over bid circular or directors’ circular referred to in Part XVII;

cbca_s115_3_i.label: (i)
cbca_s115_3_i.text: approve any financial statements referred to in section 155; or

cbca_s116.title: Validity of acts of directors and officers
cbca_s116.text: An act of a director or officer is valid notwithstanding an irregularity in their election or appointment or a defect in their qualification.

cbca_s117_1.text: A resolution in writing, signed by all the directors entitled to vote on that resolution at a meeting of directors or committee of directors, is as valid as if it had been passed at a meeting of directors or committee of directors.

cbca_s117_2.title: Filing resolution
cbca_s117_2.text: A copy of every resolution referred to in subsection (1) shall be kept with the minutes of the proceedings of the directors or committee of directors.

cbca_s117_3.title: Evidence
cbca_s117_3.text: Unless a ballot is demanded, an entry in the minutes of a meeting to the effect that the chairperson of the meeting declared a resolution to be carried or defeated is, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, proof of the fact without proof of the number or proportion of the votes recorded in favour of or against the resolution.

cbca_s118_1.text: Directors of a corporation who vote for or consent to a resolution authorizing the issue of a share under section 25 for a consideration other than money are jointly and severally, or solidarily, liable to the corporation to make good any amount by which the consideration received is less than the fair equivalent of the money that the corporation would have received if the share had been issued for money on the date of the resolution.

cbca_s118_2.title: Further directors’ liabilities
cbca_s118_2.text: Directors of a corporation who vote for or consent to a resolution authorizing any of the following are jointly and severally, or solidarily, liable to restore to the corporation any amounts so distributed or paid and not otherwise recovered by the corporation:

cbca_s118_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s118_2_a.text: a purchase, redemption or other acquisition of shares contrary to section 34, 35 or 36;

cbca_s118_2_c.label: (c)
cbca_s118_2_c.text: a payment of a dividend contrary to section 42;

cbca_s118_2_d.label: (d)
cbca_s118_2_d.text: a payment of an indemnity contrary to section 124; or

cbca_s118_2_e.label: (e)
cbca_s118_2_e.text: a payment to a shareholder contrary to section 190 or 241.

cbca_s118_3.title: Contribution
cbca_s118_3.text: A director who has satisfied a judgment rendered under this section is entitled to contribution from the other directors who voted for or consented to the unlawful act on which the judgment was founded.

cbca_s118_4.title: Recovery
cbca_s118_4.text: A director liable under subsection (2) is entitled to apply to a court for an order compelling a shareholder or other recipient to pay or deliver to the director any money or property that was paid or distributed to the shareholder or other recipient contrary to section 34, 35, 36, 41, 42, 124, 190 or 241.

cbca_s118_5.title: Order of court
cbca_s118_5.text: In connection with an application under subsection (4) a court may, if it is satisfied that it is equitable to do so,

cbca_s118_5_a.label: (a)
cbca_s118_5_a.text: order a shareholder or other recipient to pay or deliver to a director any money or property that was paid or distributed to the shareholder or other recipient contrary to section 34, 35, 36, 41, 42, 124, 190 or 241;

cbca_s118_5_b.label: (b)
cbca_s118_5_b.text: order a corporation to return or issue shares to a person from whom the corporation has purchased, redeemed or otherwise acquired shares; or

cbca_s118_5_c.label: (c)
cbca_s118_5_c.text: make any further order it thinks fit.

cbca_s118_6.title: No liability
cbca_s118_6.text: A director who proves that the director did not know and could not reasonably have known that the share was issued for a consideration less than the fair equivalent of the money that the corporation would have received if the share had been issued for money is not liable under subsection (1).

cbca_s118_7.title: Limitation
cbca_s118_7.text: An action to enforce a liability imposed by this section may not be commenced after two years from the date of the resolution authorizing the action complained of.

cbca_s119_1.text: Directors of a corporation are jointly and severally, or solidarily, liable to employees of the corporation for all debts not exceeding six months wages payable to each such employee for services performed for the corporation while they are such directors respectively.

cbca_s119_2.title: Conditions precedent to liability
cbca_s119_2.text: A director is not liable under subsection (1) unless

cbca_s119_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s119_2_a.text: the corporation has been sued for the debt within six months after it has become due and execution has been returned unsatisfied in whole or in part;

cbca_s119_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s119_2_b.text: the corporation has commenced liquidation and dissolution proceedings or has been dissolved and a claim for the debt has been proved within six months after the earlier of the date of commencement of the liquidation and dissolution proceedings and the date of dissolution; or

cbca_s119_2_c.label: (c)
cbca_s119_2_c.text: the corporation has made an assignment or a bankruptcy order has been made against it under the Bankruptcy and Insolvency Act and a claim for the debt has been proved within six months after the date of the assignment or bankruptcy order.

cbca_s119_3.title: Limitation
cbca_s119_3.text: A director, unless sued for a debt referred to in subsection (1) while a director or within two years after ceasing to be a director, is not liable under this section.

cbca_s119_4.title: Amount due after execution
cbca_s119_4.text: Where execution referred to in paragraph (2)(a) has issued, the amount recoverable from a director is the amount remaining unsatisfied after execution.

cbca_s119_5.title: Subrogation of director
cbca_s119_5.text: A director who pays a debt referred to in subsection (1) that is proved in liquidation and dissolution or bankruptcy proceedings is entitled to any priority that the employee would have been entitled to and, if a judgment has been obtained, the director is

cbca_s119_5_a.label: (a)
cbca_s119_5_a.text: in Quebec, subrogated to the employee’s rights as declared in the judgment; and

cbca_s119_5_b.label: (b)
cbca_s119_5_b.text: elsewhere in Canada, entitled to an assignment of the judgment.

cbca_s119_6.title: Contribution
cbca_s119_6.text: A director who has satisfied a claim under this section is entitled to contribution from the other directors who were liable for the claim.

cbca_s120_1.text: A director or an officer of a corporation shall disclose to the corporation, in writing or by requesting to have it entered in the minutes of meetings of directors or of meetings of committees of directors, the nature and extent of any interest that he or she has in a material contract or material transaction, whether made or proposed, with the corporation, if the director or officer

cbca_s120_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s120_1_a.text: is a party to the contract or transaction;

cbca_s120_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s120_1_b.text: is a director or an officer, or an individual acting in a similar capacity, of a party to the contract or transaction; or

cbca_s120_1_c.label: (c)
cbca_s120_1_c.text: has a material interest in a party to the contract or transaction.

cbca_s120_2.title: Time of disclosure for director
cbca_s120_2.text: The disclosure required by subsection (1) shall be made, in the case of a director,

cbca_s120_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s120_2_a.text: at the meeting at which a proposed contract or transaction is first considered;

cbca_s120_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s120_2_b.text: if the director was not, at the time of the meeting referred to in paragraph (a), interested in a proposed contract or transaction, at the first meeting after he or she becomes so interested;

cbca_s120_2_c.label: (c)
cbca_s120_2_c.text: if the director becomes interested after a contract or transaction is made, at the first meeting after he or she becomes so interested; or

cbca_s120_2_d.label: (d)
cbca_s120_2_d.text: if an individual who is interested in a contract or transaction later becomes a director, at the first meeting after he or she becomes a director.

cbca_s120_3.title: Time of disclosure for officer
cbca_s120_3.text: The disclosure required by subsection (1) shall be made, in the case of an officer who is not a director,

cbca_s120_3_a.label: (a)
cbca_s120_3_a.text: immediately after he or she becomes aware that the contract, transaction, proposed contract or proposed transaction is to be considered or has been considered at a meeting;

cbca_s120_3_b.label: (b)
cbca_s120_3_b.text: if the officer becomes interested after a contract or transaction is made, immediately after he or she becomes so interested; or

cbca_s120_3_c.label: (c)
cbca_s120_3_c.text: if an individual who is interested in a contract later becomes an officer, immediately after he or she becomes an officer.

cbca_s120_4.title: Time of disclosure for director or officer
cbca_s120_4.text: If a material contract or material transaction, whether entered into or proposed, is one that, in the ordinary course of the corporation’s business, would not require approval by the directors or shareholders, a director or officer shall disclose, in writing to the corporation or request to have it entered in the minutes of meetings of directors or of meetings of committees of directors, the nature and extent of his or her interest immediately after he or she becomes aware of the contract or transaction.

cbca_s120_5.title: Voting
cbca_s120_5.text: A director required to make a disclosure under subsection (1) shall not vote on any resolution to approve the contract or transaction unless the contract or transaction

cbca_s120_5_a.label: (a)
cbca_s120_5_a.text: relates primarily to his or her remuneration as a director, officer, employee, agent or mandatary of the corporation or an affiliate;

cbca_s120_5_b.label: (b)
cbca_s120_5_b.text: is for indemnity or insurance under section 124; or

cbca_s120_6.title: Continuing disclosure
cbca_s120_6.text: For the purposes of this section, a general notice to the directors declaring that a director or an officer is to be regarded as interested, for any of the following reasons, in a contract or transaction made with a party, is a sufficient declaration of interest in relation to the contract or transaction:

cbca_s120_6_a.label: (a)
cbca_s120_6_a.text: the director or officer is a director or officer, or acting in a similar capacity, of a party referred to in paragraph (1)(b) or (c);

cbca_s120_6_b.label: (b)
cbca_s120_6_b.text: the director or officer has a material interest in the party; or

cbca_s120_6_c.label: (c)
cbca_s120_6_c.text: there has been a material change in the nature of the director’s or the officer’s interest in the party.

cbca_s120_6.1.title: Access to disclosures
cbca_s120_6.1.text: The shareholders of the corporation may examine the portions of any minutes of meetings of directors or of committees of directors that contain disclosures under this section, and any other documents that contain those disclosures, during the usual business hours of the corporation.

cbca_s120_7.title: Avoidance standards
cbca_s120_7.text: A contract or transaction for which disclosure is required under subsection (1) is not invalid, and the director or officer is not accountable to the corporation or its shareholders for any profit realized from the contract or transaction, because of the director’s or officer’s interest in the contract or transaction or because the director was present or was counted to determine whether a quorum existed at the meeting of directors or committee of directors that considered the contract or transaction, if

cbca_s120_7_a.label: (a)
cbca_s120_7_a.text: disclosure of the interest was made in accordance with subsections (1) to (6);

cbca_s120_7_b.label: (b)
cbca_s120_7_b.text: the directors approved the contract or transaction; and

cbca_s120_7_c.label: (c)
cbca_s120_7_c.text: the contract or transaction was reasonable and fair to the corporation when it was approved.

cbca_s120_7.1.title: Confirmation by shareholders
cbca_s120_7.1.text: Even if the conditions of subsection (7) are not met, a director or officer, acting honestly and in good faith, is not accountable to the corporation or to its shareholders for any profit realized from a contract or transaction for which disclosure is required under subsection (1), and the contract or transaction is not invalid by reason only of the interest of the director or officer in the contract or transaction, if

cbca_s120_7.1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s120_7.1_a.text: the contract or transaction is approved or confirmed by special resolution at a meeting of the shareholders;

cbca_s120_7.1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s120_7.1_b.text: disclosure of the interest was made to the shareholders in a manner sufficient to indicate its nature before the contract or transaction was approved or confirmed; and

cbca_s120_7.1_c.label: (c)
cbca_s120_7.1_c.text: the contract or transaction was reasonable and fair to the corporation when it was approved or confirmed.

cbca_s120_8.title: Application to court
cbca_s120_8.text: If a director or an officer of a corporation fails to comply with this section, a court may, on application of the corporation or any of its shareholders, set aside the contract or transaction on any terms that it thinks fit, or require the director or officer to account to the corporation for any profit or gain realized on it, or do both those things.

cbca_s121.title: Officers
cbca_s121.text: Subject to the articles, the by-laws or any unanimous shareholder agreement,

cbca_s121_a.label: (a)
cbca_s121_a.text: the directors may designate the offices of the corporation, appoint as officers persons of full capacity, specify their duties and delegate to them powers to manage the business and affairs of the corporation, except powers to do anything referred to in subsection 115(3);

cbca_s121_b.label: (b)
cbca_s121_b.text: a director may be appointed to any office of the corporation; and

cbca_s121_c.label: (c)
cbca_s121_c.text: two or more offices of the corporation may be held by the same person.

cbca_s122.title: Duty of care of directors and officers

cbca_s122_1.text: Every director and officer of a corporation in exercising their powers and discharging their duties shall

cbca_s122_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s122_1_a.text: act honestly and in good faith with a view to the best interests of the corporation; and

cbca_s122_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s122_1_b.text: exercise the care, diligence and skill that a reasonably prudent person would exercise in comparable circumstances.

cbca_s122_1.1.title: Best interests of the corporation
cbca_s122_1.1.text: When acting with a view to the best interests of the corporation under paragraph (1)(a), the directors and officers of the corporation may consider, but are not limited to, the following factors:

cbca_s122_1.1_c.label: (c)
cbca_s122_1.1_c.text: the long-term interests of the corporation.

cbca_s122_2.title: Duty to comply
cbca_s122_2.text: Every director and officer of a corporation shall comply with this Act, the regulations, articles, by-laws and any unanimous shareholder agreement.

cbca_s122_3.title: No exculpation
cbca_s122_3.text: Subject to subsection 146(5), no provision in a contract, the articles, the by-laws or a resolution relieves a director or officer from the duty to act in accordance with this Act or the regulations or relieves them from liability for a breach thereof.

cbca_s123_1.text: A director who is present at a meeting of directors or committee of directors is deemed to have consented to any resolution passed or action taken at the meeting unless

cbca_s123_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s123_1_a.text: the director requests a dissent to be entered in the minutes of the meeting, or the dissent has been entered in the minutes;

cbca_s123_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s123_1_b.text: the director sends a written dissent to the secretary of the meeting before the meeting is adjourned; or

cbca_s123_1_c.label: (c)
cbca_s123_1_c.text: the director sends a dissent by registered mail or delivers it to the registered office of the corporation immediately after the meeting is adjourned.

cbca_s123_2.title: Loss of right to dissent
cbca_s123_2.text: A director who votes for or consents to a resolution is not entitled to dissent under subsection (1).

cbca_s123_3.title: Dissent of absent director
cbca_s123_3.text: A director who was not present at a meeting at which a resolution was passed or action taken is deemed to have consented thereto unless within seven days after becoming aware of the resolution, the director aware or the resolution, the director

cbca_s123_3_a.label: (a)
cbca_s123_3_a.text: causes a dissent to be placed with the minutes of the meeting; or

cbca_s123_3_b.label: (b)
cbca_s123_3_b.text: sends a dissent by registered mail or delivers it to the registered office of the corporation.

cbca_s123_4.title: Defence — reasonable diligence
cbca_s123_4.text: A director is not liable under section 118 or 119, and has complied with his or her duties under subsection 122(2), if the director exercised the care, diligence and skill that a reasonably prudent person would have exercised in comparable circumstances, including reliance in good faith on

cbca_s123_4_a.label: (a)
cbca_s123_4_a.text: financial statements of the corporation represented to the director by an officer of the corporation or in a written report of the auditor of the corporation fairly to reflect the financial condition of the corporation; or

cbca_s123_4_b.label: (b)
cbca_s123_4_b.text: a report of a person whose profession lends credibility to a statement made by the professional person.

cbca_s123_5.title: Defence — good faith
cbca_s123_5.text: A director has complied with his or her duties under subsection 122(1) if the director relied in good faith on

cbca_s123_5_a.label: (a)
cbca_s123_5_a.text: financial statements of the corporation represented to the director by an officer of the corporation or in a written report of the auditor of the corporation fairly to reflect the financial condition of the corporation; or

cbca_s123_5_b.label: (b)
cbca_s123_5_b.text: a report of a person whose profession lends credibility to a statement made by the professional person.

cbca_s124_1.text: A corporation may indemnify a director or officer of the corporation, a former director or officer of the corporation or another individual who acts or acted at the corporation’s request as a director or officer, or an individual acting in a similar capacity, of another entity, against all costs, charges and expenses, including an amount paid to settle an action or satisfy a judgment, reasonably incurred by the individual in respect of any civil, criminal, administrative, investigative or other proceeding in which the individual is involved because of that association with the corporation or other entity.

cbca_s124_2.title: Advance of costs
cbca_s124_2.text: A corporation may advance moneys to a director, officer or other individual for the costs, charges and expenses of a proceeding referred to in subsection (1). The individual shall repay the moneys if the individual does not fulfil the conditions of subsection (3).

cbca_s124_3.title: Limitation
cbca_s124_3.text: A corporation may not indemnify an individual under subsection (1) unless the individual

cbca_s124_3_a.label: (a)
cbca_s124_3_a.text: acted honestly and in good faith with a view to the best interests of the corporation, or, as the case may be, to the best interests of the other entity for which the individual acted as director or officer or in a similar capacity at the corporation’s request; and

cbca_s124_3_b.label: (b)
cbca_s124_3_b.text: in the case of a criminal or administrative action or proceeding that is enforced by a monetary penalty, the individual had reasonable grounds for believing that the individual’s conduct was lawful.

cbca_s124_4.title: Indemnification in derivative actions
cbca_s124_4.text: A corporation may with the approval of a court, indemnify an individual referred to in subsection (1), or advance moneys under subsection (2), in respect of an action by or on behalf of the corporation or other entity to procure a judgment in its favour, to which the individual is made a party because of the individual’s association with the corporation or other entity as described in subsection (1) against all costs, charges and expenses reasonably incurred by the individual in connection with such action, if the individual fulfils the conditions set out in subsection (3).

cbca_s124_5.title: Right to indemnity
cbca_s124_5.text: Despite subsection (1), an individual referred to in that subsection is entitled to indemnity from the corporation in respect of all costs, charges and expenses reasonably incurred by the individual in connection with the defence of any civil, criminal, administrative, investigative or other proceeding to which the individual is subject because of the individual’s association with the corporation or other entity as described in subsection (1), if the individual seeking indemnity

cbca_s124_5_a.label: (a)
cbca_s124_5_a.text: was not judged by the court or other competent authority to have committed any fault or omitted to do anything that the individual ought to have done; and

cbca_s124_5_b.label: (b)
cbca_s124_5_b.text: fulfils the conditions set out in subsection (3).

cbca_s124_6.title: Insurance
cbca_s124_6.text: A corporation may purchase and maintain insurance for the benefit of an individual referred to in subsection (1) against any liability incurred by the individual

cbca_s124_6_a.label: (a)
cbca_s124_6_a.text: in the individual’s capacity as a director or officer of the corporation; or

cbca_s124_6_b.label: (b)
cbca_s124_6_b.text: in the individual’s capacity as a director or officer, or similar capacity, of another entity, if the individual acts or acted in that capacity at the corporation’s request.

cbca_s124_7.title: Application to court
cbca_s124_7.text: A corporation, an individual or an entity referred to in subsection (1) may apply to a court for an order approving an indemnity under this section and the court may so order and make any further order that it sees fit.

cbca_s124_8.title: Notice to Director
cbca_s124_8.text: An applicant under subsection (7) shall give the Director notice of the application and the Director is entitled to appear and be heard in person or by counsel.

cbca_s124_9.title: Other notice
cbca_s124_9.text: On an application under subsection (7) the court may order notice to be given to any interested person and the person is entitled to appear and be heard in person or by counsel.

cbca_s125.title: Remuneration
cbca_s125.text: Subject to the articles, the by-laws or any unanimous shareholder agreement, the directors of a corporation may fix the remuneration of the directors, officers and employees of the corporation.

cbca_s126_2.title: Further interpretation
cbca_s126_2.text: For the purposes of this Part,

cbca_s126_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s126_2_a.text: a director or an officer of a body corporate that beneficially owns, directly or indirectly, shares of a distributing corporation, or that exercises control or direction over shares of the distributing corporation, or that has a combination of any such ownership, control and direction, carrying more than the prescribed percentage of voting rights attached to all of the outstanding shares of the distributing corporation not including shares held by the body corporate as underwriter while those shares are in the course of a distribution to the public is deemed to be an insider of the distributing corporation;

cbca_s126_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s126_2_b.text: a director or an officer of a body corporate that is a subsidiary is deemed to be an insider of its holding distributing corporation;

cbca_s126_2_c.label: (c)
cbca_s126_2_c.text: a person is deemed to beneficially own shares that are beneficially owned by a body corporate controlled directly or indirectly by the person;

cbca_s126_2_d.label: (d)
cbca_s126_2_d.text: a body corporate is deemed to own beneficially shares beneficially owned by its affiliates; and

cbca_s126_2_e.label: (e)
cbca_s126_2_e.text: the acquisition or disposition by an insider of an option or right to acquire a share is deemed to be a change in the beneficial ownership of the share to which the option or right to acquire relates.

cbca_s130_1.text: An insider shall not knowingly sell, directly or indirectly, a security of a distributing corporation or any of its affiliates if the insider selling the security does not own or has not fully paid for the security to be sold.

cbca_s130_2.title: Calls and puts
cbca_s130_2.text: An insider shall not knowingly, directly or indirectly, sell a call or buy a put in respect of a security of the corporation or any of its affiliates.

cbca_s130_3.title: Exception
cbca_s130_3.text: Despite subsection (1), an insider may sell a security they do not own if they own another security convertible into the security sold or an option or right to acquire the security sold and, within ten days after the sale, they

cbca_s130_3_a.label: (a)
cbca_s130_3_a.text: exercise the conversion privilege, option or right and deliver the security so acquired to the purchaser; or

cbca_s130_3_b.label: (b)
cbca_s130_3_b.text: transfer the convertible security, option or right to the purchaser.

cbca_s130_4.title: Offence
cbca_s130_4.text: An insider who contravenes subsection (1) or (2) is guilty of an offence and liable on summary conviction to a fine not exceeding the greater of one million dollars and three times the profit made, or to imprisonment for a term not exceeding six months or to both.

cbca_s131_1.text: In this section, insider means, with respect to a corporation,

cbca_s131_1_c.label: (c)
cbca_s131_1_c.text: a director or an officer of the corporation or of any person described in paragraph (b), (d) or (f);

cbca_s131_1_d.label: (d)
cbca_s131_1_d.text: a person who beneficially owns, directly or indirectly, shares of the corporation or who exercises control or direction over shares of the corporation, or who has a combination of any such ownership, control and direction, carrying more than the prescribed percentage of voting rights attached to all of the outstanding shares of the corporation not including shares held by the person as underwriter while those shares are in the course of a distribution to the public;

cbca_s131_1_e.label: (e)
cbca_s131_1_e.text: a person, other than a person described in paragraph (f), employed or retained by the corporation or by a person described in paragraph (f);

cbca_s131_1_f.label: (f)
cbca_s131_1_f.text: a person who engages in or proposes to engage in any business or professional activity with or on behalf of the corporation;

cbca_s131_1_g.label: (g)
cbca_s131_1_g.text: a person who received, while they were a person described in any of paragraphs (a) to (f), material confidential information concerning the corporation;

cbca_s131_1_h.label: (h)
cbca_s131_1_h.text: a person who receives material confidential information from a person described in this subsection or in subsection (3) or (3.1), including a person described in this paragraph, and who knows or who ought reasonably to have known that the person giving the information is a person described in this subsection or in subsection (3) or (3.1), including a person described in this paragraph; and

cbca_s131_2.title: Expanded definition of security
cbca_s131_2.text: For the purposes of this section, the following are deemed to be a security of the corporation:

cbca_s131_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s131_2_a.text: a put, call, option or other right or obligation to purchase or sell a security of the corporation; and

cbca_s131_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s131_2_b.text: a security of another entity, the market price of which varies materially with the market price of the securities of the corporation.

cbca_s131_3.title: Deemed insiders
cbca_s131_3.text: For the purposes of this section, a person who proposes to make a take-over bid (as defined in the regulations) for securities of a corporation, or to enter into a business combination with a corporation, is an insider of the corporation with respect to material confidential information obtained from the corporation and is an insider of the corporation for the purposes of subsection (6).

cbca_s131_3.1.title: Deemed insiders
cbca_s131_3.1.text: An insider of a person referred to in subsection (3), and an affiliate or associate of such a person, is an insider of the corporation referred to in that subsection. Paragraphs (1)(b) to (i) apply in determining whether a person is such an insider except that references to “corporation” in those paragraphs are to be read as references to “person described in subsection (3)”.

cbca_s131_4.title: Insider trading — compensation to persons
cbca_s131_4.text: An insider who purchases or sells a security of the corporation with knowledge of confidential information that, if generally known, might reasonably be expected to affect materially the value of any of the securities of the corporation is liable to compensate the seller of the security or the purchaser of the security, as the case may be, for any damages suffered by the seller or purchaser as a result of the purchase or sale, unless the insider establishes that

cbca_s131_4_a.label: (a)
cbca_s131_4_a.text: the insider reasonably believed that the information had been generally disclosed;

cbca_s131_4_b.label: (b)
cbca_s131_4_b.text: the information was known, or ought reasonably to have been known, by the seller or purchaser; or

cbca_s131_4_c.label: (c)
cbca_s131_4_c.text: the purchase or sale of the security took place in the prescribed circumstances.

cbca_s131_5.title: Insider trading — compensation to corporation
cbca_s131_5.text: The insider is accountable to the corporation for any benefit or advantage received or receivable by the insider as a result of a purchase or sale described in subsection (4) unless the insider establishes the circumstances described in paragraph (4)(a).

cbca_s131_6.title: Tipping — compensation to persons
cbca_s131_6.text: An insider of the corporation who discloses to another person confidential information with respect to the corporation that has not been generally disclosed and that, if generally known, might reasonably be expected to affect materially the value of any of the securities of the corporation is liable to compensate for damages any person who subsequently sells securities of the corporation to, or purchases securities of the corporation from, any person that received the information, unless the insider establishes

cbca_s131_6_a.label: (a)
cbca_s131_6_a.text: that the insider reasonably believed that the information had been generally disclosed;

cbca_s131_6_b.label: (b)
cbca_s131_6_b.text: that the information was known, or ought reasonably to have been known, by the person who alleges to have suffered the damages;

cbca_s131_6_c.label: (c)
cbca_s131_6_c.text: that the disclosure of the information was necessary in the course of the business of the insider, except if the insider is a person described in subsection (3) or (3.1); or

cbca_s131_6_d.label: (d)
cbca_s131_6_d.text: if the insider is a person described in subsection (3) or (3.1), that the disclosure of the information was necessary to effect the take-over bid or the business combination, as the case may be.

cbca_s131_7.title: Tipping — compensation to corporation
cbca_s131_7.text: The insider is accountable to the corporation for any benefit or advantage received or receivable by the insider as a result of a disclosure of the information as described in subsection (6) unless the insider establishes the circumstances described in paragraph (6)(a), (c) or (d).

cbca_s131_8.title: Measure of damages
cbca_s131_8.text: The court may assess damages under subsection (4) or (6) in accordance with any measure of damages that it considers relevant in the circumstances. However, in assessing damages in a situation involving a security of a distributing corporation, the court must consider the following:

cbca_s131_8_a.label: (a)
cbca_s131_8_a.text: if the plaintiff is a purchaser, the price paid by the plaintiff for the security less the average market price of the security over the twenty trading days immediately following general disclosure of the information; and

cbca_s131_8_b.label: (b)
cbca_s131_8_b.text: if the plaintiff is a seller, the average market price of the security over the twenty trading days immediately following general disclosure of the information, less the price that the plaintiff received for the security.

cbca_s131_9.title: Liability
cbca_s131_9.text: If more than one insider is liable under subsection (4) or (6) with respect to the same transaction or series of transactions, their liability is joint and several, or solidary.

cbca_s131_10.title: Limitation
cbca_s131_10.text: An action to enforce a right created by subsections (4) to (7) may be commenced only within two years after discovery of the facts that gave rise to the cause of action.

cbca_s132_1.text: Meetings of shareholders of a corporation shall be held at the place within Canada provided in the by-laws or, in the absence of such provision, at the place within Canada that the directors determine.

cbca_s132_2.title: Meeting outside Canada
cbca_s132_2.text: Despite subsection (1), a meeting of shareholders of a corporation may be held at a place outside Canada if the place is specified in the articles or all the shareholders entitled to vote at the meeting agree that the meeting is to be held at that place.

cbca_s132_3.title: Exception
cbca_s132_3.text: A shareholder who attends a meeting of shareholders held outside Canada is deemed to have agreed to it being held outside Canada except when the shareholder attends the meeting for the express purpose of objecting to the transaction of any business on the grounds that the meeting is not lawfully held.

cbca_s132_4.title: Participation in meeting by electronic means
cbca_s132_4.text: Unless the by-laws otherwise provide, any person entitled to attend a meeting of shareholders may participate in the meeting, in accordance with the regulations, if any, by means of a telephonic, electronic or other communication facility that permits all participants to communicate adequately with each other during the meeting, if the corporation makes available such a communication facility. A person participating in a meeting by such means is deemed for the purposes of this Act to be present at the meeting.

cbca_s132_5.title: Meeting held by electronic means
cbca_s132_5.text: If the directors or the shareholders of a corporation call a meeting of shareholders pursuant to this Act, those directors or shareholders, as the case may be, may determine that the meeting shall be held, in accordance with the regulations, if any, entirely by means of a telephonic, electronic or other communication facility that permits all participants to communicate adequately with each other during the meeting, if the by-laws so provide.

cbca_s133_1.text: The directors of a corporation shall call an annual meeting of shareholders

cbca_s133_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s133_1_a.text: not later than eighteen months after the corporation comes into existence; and

cbca_s133_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s133_1_b.text: subsequently, not later than fifteen months after holding the last preceding annual meeting but no later than six months after the end of the corporation’s preceding financial year.

cbca_s133_2.title: Calling special meetings
cbca_s133_2.text: The directors of a corporation may at any time call a special meeting of shareholders.

cbca_s133_3.title: Order to delay calling of annual meeting
cbca_s133_3.text: Despite subsection (1), the corporation may apply to the court for an order extending the time for calling an annual meeting.

cbca_s134_1.text: The directors may, within the prescribed period, fix in advance a date as the record date for the purpose of determining shareholders

cbca_s134_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s134_1_a.text: entitled to receive payment of a dividend;

cbca_s134_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s134_1_b.text: entitled to participate in a liquidation distribution;

cbca_s134_1_c.label: (c)
cbca_s134_1_c.text: entitled to receive notice of a meeting of shareholders;

cbca_s134_1_d.label: (d)
cbca_s134_1_d.text: entitled to vote at a meeting of shareholders; or

cbca_s134_2.title: No record date fixed
cbca_s134_2.text: If no record date is fixed,

cbca_s134_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s134_2_a.text: the record date for the determination of shareholders entitled to receive notice of a meeting of shareholders shall be

cbca_s134_2_a_i.label: (i)
cbca_s134_2_a_i.text: at the close of business on the day immediately preceding the day on which the notice is given, or

cbca_s134_2_a_ii.label: (ii)
cbca_s134_2_a_ii.text: if no notice is given, the day on which the meeting is held; and

cbca_s134_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s134_2_b.text: the record date for the determination of shareholders for any purpose other than to establish a shareholder’s right to receive notice of a meeting or to vote shall be at the close of business on the day on which the directors pass the resolution relating thereto.

cbca_s134_3.title: When record date fixed
cbca_s134_3.text: If a record date is fixed, unless notice of the record date is waived in writing by every holder of a share of the class or series affected whose name is set out in the securities register at the close of business on the day the directors fix the record date, notice of the record date must be given within the prescribed period

cbca_s134_3_a.label: (a)
cbca_s134_3_a.text: by advertisement in a newspaper published or distributed in the place where the corporation has its registered office and in each place in Canada where it has a transfer agent or where a transfer of its shares may be recorded; and

cbca_s134_3_b.label: (b)
cbca_s134_3_b.text: by written notice to each stock exchange in Canada on which the shares of the corporation are listed for trading.

cbca_s135_1.text: Notice of the time and place of a meeting of shareholders shall be sent within the prescribed period to

cbca_s135_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s135_1_a.text: each shareholder entitled to vote at the meeting;

cbca_s135_1.1.title: Exception — not a distributing corporation
cbca_s135_1.1.text: In the case of a corporation that is not a distributing corporation, the notice may be sent within a shorter period if so specified in the articles or by-laws.

cbca_s135_2.title: Exception — shareholders not registered
cbca_s135_2.text: A notice of a meeting is not required to be sent to shareholders who were not registered on the records of the corporation or its transfer agent on the record date determined under paragraph 134(1)(c) or subsection 134(2), but failure to receive a notice does not deprive a shareholder of the right to vote at the meeting.

cbca_s135_3.title: Adjournment
cbca_s135_3.text: If a meeting of shareholders is adjourned for less than thirty days it is not necessary, unless the by-laws otherwise provide, to give notice of the adjourned meeting, other than by announcement at the earliest meeting that is adjourned.

cbca_s135_4.title: Notice of adjourned meeting
cbca_s135_4.text: If a meeting of shareholders is adjourned by one or more adjournments for an aggregate of thirty days or more, notice of the adjourned meeting shall be given as for an original meeting but, unless the meeting is adjourned by one or more adjournments for an aggregate of more than ninety days, subsection 149(1) does not apply.

cbca_s135_5.title: Business
cbca_s135_5.text: All business transacted at a special meeting of shareholders and all business transacted at an annual meeting of shareholders, except consideration of the financial statements, auditor’s report, election of directors and re-appointment of the incumbent auditor, is deemed to be special business.

cbca_s135_6.title: Notice of business
cbca_s135_6.text: Notice of a meeting of shareholders at which special business is to be transacted shall state

cbca_s135_6_a.label: (a)
cbca_s135_6_a.text: the nature of that business in sufficient detail to permit the shareholder to form a reasoned judgment thereon; and

cbca_s135_6_b.label: (b)
cbca_s135_6_b.text: the text of any special resolution to be submitted to the meeting.

cbca_s136.title: Waiver of notice
cbca_s136.text: A shareholder or any other person entitled to attend a meeting of shareholders may in any manner waive notice of a meeting of shareholders, and their attendance at a meeting of shareholders is a waiver of notice of the meeting, except where they attend a meeting for the express purpose of objecting to the transaction of any business on the grounds that the meeting is not lawfully called.

cbca_s137_1.text: Subject to subsections (1.1) and (1.2), a registered holder or beneficial owner of shares that are entitled to be voted at an annual meeting of shareholders may

cbca_s137_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s137_1_a.text: submit to the corporation notice of any matter that the person proposes to raise at the meeting (a “proposal”); and

cbca_s137_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s137_1_b.text: discuss at the meeting any matter in respect of which the person would have been entitled to submit a proposal.

cbca_s137_1.1.title: Persons eligible to make proposals
cbca_s137_1.1.text: To be eligible to submit a proposal, a person

cbca_s137_1.1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s137_1.1_a.text: must be, for at least the prescribed period, the registered holder or the beneficial owner of at least the prescribed number of outstanding shares of the corporation; or

cbca_s137_1.1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s137_1.1_b.text: must have the support of persons who, in the aggregate, and including or not including the person that submits the proposal, have been, for at least the prescribed period, the registered holders, or the beneficial owners of, at least the prescribed number of outstanding shares of the corporation.

cbca_s137_1.2.title: Information to be provided
cbca_s137_1.2.text: A proposal submitted under paragraph (1)(a) must be accompanied by the following information:

cbca_s137_1.2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s137_1.2_a.text: the name and address of the person and of the person’s supporters, if applicable; and

cbca_s137_1.2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s137_1.2_b.text: the number of shares held or owned by the person and the person’s supporters, if applicable, and the date the shares were acquired.

cbca_s137_1.3.title: Information not part of proposal
cbca_s137_1.3.text: The information provided under subsection (1.2) does not form part of the proposal or of the supporting statement referred to in subsection (3) and is not included for the purposes of the prescribed maximum word limit set out in subsection (3).

cbca_s137_1.4.title: Proof may be required
cbca_s137_1.4.text: If requested by the corporation within the prescribed period, a person who submits a proposal must provide proof, within the prescribed period, that the person meets the requirements of subsection (1.1).

cbca_s137_2.title: Information circular
cbca_s137_2.text: A corporation that solicits proxies shall set out the proposal in the management proxy circular required by section 150 or attach the proposal thereto.

cbca_s137_3.title: Supporting statement
cbca_s137_3.text: If so requested by the person who submits a proposal, the corporation shall include in the management proxy circular or attach to it a statement in support of the proposal by the person and the name and address of the person. The statement and the proposal must together not exceed the prescribed maximum number of words.

cbca_s137_4.title: Nomination for director
cbca_s137_4.text: A proposal may include nominations for the election of directors if the proposal is signed by one or more holders of shares representing in the aggregate not less than five per cent of the shares or five per cent of the shares of a class of shares of the corporation entitled to vote at the meeting to which the proposal is to be presented, but this subsection does not preclude nominations made at a meeting of shareholders.

cbca_s137_5.title: Exemptions
cbca_s137_5.text: A corporation is not required to comply with subsections (2) and (3) if

cbca_s137_5_a.label: (a)
cbca_s137_5_a.text: the proposal is not submitted to the corporation within the prescribed period;

cbca_s137_5_b.label: (b)
cbca_s137_5_b.text: it clearly appears that the primary purpose of the proposal is to enforce a personal claim or redress a personal grievance against the corporation or its directors, officers or security holders;

cbca_s137_5_b.1.label: (b.1)
cbca_s137_5_b.1.text: it clearly appears that the proposal does not relate in a significant way to the business or affairs of the corporation;

cbca_s137_5_c.label: (c)
cbca_s137_5_c.text: not more than the prescribed period before the receipt of a proposal, a person failed to present, in person or by proxy, at a meeting of shareholders, a proposal that at the person’s request, had been included in a management proxy circular relating to the meeting;

cbca_s137_5_d.label: (d)
cbca_s137_5_d.text: substantially the same proposal was submitted to shareholders in a management proxy circular or a dissident’s proxy circular relating to a meeting of shareholders held not more than the prescribed period before the receipt of the proposal and did not receive the prescribed minimum amount of support at the meeting; or

cbca_s137_5_e.label: (e)
cbca_s137_5_e.text: the rights conferred by this section are being abused to secure publicity.

cbca_s137_5.1.title: Corporation may refuse to include proposal
cbca_s137_5.1.text: If a person who submits a proposal fails to continue to hold or own the number of shares referred to in subsection (1.1) up to and including the day of the meeting, the corporation is not required to set out in the management proxy circular, or attach to it, any proposal submitted by that person for any meeting held within the prescribed period following the date of the meeting.

cbca_s137_6.title: Immunity
cbca_s137_6.text: No corporation or person acting on its behalf incurs any liability by reason only of circulating a proposal or statement in compliance with this section.

cbca_s137_7.title: Notice of refusal
cbca_s137_7.text: If a corporation refuses to include a proposal in a management proxy circular, the corporation shall, within the prescribed period after the day on which it receives the proposal or the day on which it receives the proof of ownership under subsection (1.4), as the case may be, notify in writing the person submitting the proposal of its intention to omit the proposal from the management proxy circular and of the reasons for the refusal.

cbca_s137_8.title: Person may apply to court
cbca_s137_8.text: On the application of a person submitting a proposal who claims to be aggrieved by a corporation’s refusal under subsection (7), a court may restrain the holding of the meeting to which the proposal is sought to be presented and make any further order it thinks fit.

cbca_s137_9.title: Corporation’s application to court
cbca_s137_9.text: The corporation or any person claiming to be aggrieved by a proposal may apply to a court for an order permitting the corporation to omit the proposal from the management proxy circular, and the court, if it is satisfied that subsection (5) applies, may make such order as it thinks fit.

cbca_s137_10.title: Director entitled to notice
cbca_s137_10.text: An applicant under subsection (8) or (9) shall give the Director notice of the application and the Director is entitled to appear and be heard in person or by counsel.

cbca_s138.title: List of shareholders entitled to receive notice

cbca_s138_1.text: A corporation shall prepare an alphabetical list of its shareholders entitled to receive notice of a meeting, showing the number of shares held by each shareholder,

cbca_s138_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s138_1_a.text: if a record date is fixed under paragraph 134(1)(c), not later than ten days after that date; or

cbca_s138_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s138_1_b.text: if no record date is fixed, on the record date established under paragraph 134(2)(a).

cbca_s138_2.title: Voting list — if record date fixed
cbca_s138_2.text: If a record date for voting is fixed under paragraph 134(1)(d), the corporation shall prepare, no later than ten days after the record date, an alphabetical list of shareholders entitled to vote as of the record date at a meeting of shareholders that shows the number of shares held by each shareholder.

cbca_s138_3.title: Voting list — if no record date fixed
cbca_s138_3.text: If a record date for voting is not fixed under paragraph 134(1)(d), the corporation shall prepare, not later than 10 days after the record date that is fixed under paragraph 134(1)(c) or not later than the record date that is established under paragraph 134(2)(a), as the case may be, an alphabetical list of shareholders who are entitled to vote as of the record date that shows the number of shares held by each shareholder.

cbca_s138_3.1.title: Entitlement to vote
cbca_s138_3.1.text: A shareholder whose name appears on a list prepared under subsection (2) or (3) is entitled to vote the shares shown opposite their name at the meeting to which the list relates.

cbca_s138_4.title: Examination of list
cbca_s138_4.text: A shareholder may examine the list of shareholders

cbca_s138_4_a.label: (a)
cbca_s138_4_a.text: during usual business hours at the registered office of the corporation or at the place where its central securities register is maintained; and

cbca_s138_4_b.label: (b)
cbca_s138_4_b.text: at the meeting of shareholders for which the list was prepared.

cbca_s139_1.text: Unless the by-laws otherwise provide, a quorum of shareholders is present at a meeting of shareholders, irrespective of the number of persons actually present at the meeting, if the holders of a majority of the shares entitled to vote at the meeting are present in person or represented by proxy.

cbca_s139_2.title: Opening quorum sufficient
cbca_s139_2.text: If a quorum is present at the opening of a meeting of shareholders, the shareholders present may, unless the by-laws otherwise provide, proceed with the business of the meeting, notwithstanding that a quorum is not present throughout the meeting.

cbca_s139_3.title: Adjournment
cbca_s139_3.text: If a quorum is not present at the opening of a meeting of shareholders, the shareholders present may adjourn the meeting to a fixed time and place but may not transact any other business.

cbca_s139_4.title: One shareholder meeting
cbca_s139_4.text: If a corporation has only one shareholder, or only one holder of any class or series of shares, the shareholder present in person or by proxy constitutes a meeting.

cbca_s140_1.text: Unless the articles otherwise provide, each share of a corporation entitles the holder thereof to one vote at a meeting of shareholders.

cbca_s140_2.title: Representative
cbca_s140_2.text: If a body corporate or association is a shareholder of a corporation, the corporation shall recognize any individual authorized by a resolution of the directors or governing body of the body corporate or association to represent it at meetings of shareholders of the corporation.

cbca_s140_3.title: Powers of representative
cbca_s140_3.text: An individual authorized under subsection (2) may exercise on behalf of the body corporate or association all the powers it could exercise if it were an individual shareholder.

cbca_s140_4.title: Joint shareholders
cbca_s140_4.text: Unless the by-laws otherwise provide, if two or more persons hold shares jointly, one of those holders present at a meeting of shareholders may in the absence of the others vote the shares, but if two or more of those persons who are present, in person or by proxy, vote, they shall vote as one on the shares jointly held by them.

cbca_s141_1.text: Unless the by-laws otherwise provide, voting at a meeting of shareholders shall be by show of hands except where a ballot is demanded by a shareholder or proxyholder entitled to vote at the meeting.

cbca_s141_2.title: Ballot
cbca_s141_2.text: A shareholder or proxyholder may demand a ballot either before or after any vote by show of hands.

cbca_s141_3.title: Electronic voting
cbca_s141_3.text: Despite subsection (1), unless the by-laws otherwise provide, any vote referred to in subsection (1) may be held, in accordance with the regulations, if any, entirely by means of a telephonic, electronic or other communication facility, if the corporation makes available such a communication facility.

cbca_s141_4.title: Voting while participating electronically
cbca_s141_4.text: Unless the by-laws otherwise provide, any person participating in a meeting of shareholders under subsection 132(4) or (5) and entitled to vote at that meeting may vote, in accordance with the regulations, if any, by means of the telephonic, electronic or other communication facility that the corporation has made available for that purpose.

cbca_s142_1.text: Except where a written statement is submitted by a director under subsection 110(2) or by an auditor under subsection 168(5),

cbca_s142_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s142_1_a.text: a resolution in writing signed by all the shareholders entitled to vote on that resolution at a meeting of shareholders is as valid as if it had been passed at a meeting of the shareholders; and

cbca_s142_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s142_1_b.text: a resolution in writing dealing with all matters required by this Act to be dealt with at a meeting of shareholders, and signed by all the shareholders entitled to vote at that meeting, satisfies all the requirements of this Act relating to meetings of shareholders.

cbca_s142_2.title: Filing resolution
cbca_s142_2.text: A copy of every resolution referred to in subsection (1) shall be kept with the minutes of the meetings of shareholders.

cbca_s142_3.title: Evidence
cbca_s142_3.text: Unless a ballot is demanded, an entry in the minutes of a meeting to the effect that the chairperson of the meeting declared a resolution to be carried or defeated is, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, proof of the fact without proof of the number or proportion of the votes recorded in favour of or against the resolution.

cbca_s143_1.text: The holders of not less than five per cent of the issued shares of a corporation that carry the right to vote at a meeting sought to be held may requisition the directors to call a meeting of shareholders for the purposes stated in the requisition.

cbca_s143_2.title: Form
cbca_s143_2.text: The requisition referred to in subsection (1), which may consist of several documents of like form each signed by one or more shareholders, shall state the business to be transacted at the meeting and shall be sent to each director and to the registered office of the corporation.

cbca_s143_3.title: Directors calling meeting
cbca_s143_3.text: On receiving the requisition referred to in subsection (1), the directors shall call a meeting of shareholders to transact the business stated in the requisition, unless

cbca_s143_3_a.label: (a)
cbca_s143_3_a.text: a record date has been fixed under paragraph 134(1)(c) and notice of it has been given under subsection 134(3);

cbca_s143_3_b.label: (b)
cbca_s143_3_b.text: the directors have called a meeting of shareholders and have given notice thereof under section 135; or

cbca_s143_3_c.label: (c)
cbca_s143_3_c.text: the business of the meeting as stated in the requisition includes matters described in paragraphs 137(5)(b) to (e).

cbca_s143_4.title: Shareholder calling meeting
cbca_s143_4.text: If the directors do not within twenty-one days after receiving the requisition referred to in subsection (1) call a meeting, any shareholder who signed the requisition may call the meeting.

cbca_s143_5.title: Procedure
cbca_s143_5.text: A meeting called under this section shall be called as nearly as possible in the manner in which meetings are to be called pursuant to the by-laws, this Part and Part XIII.

cbca_s143_6.title: Reimbursement
cbca_s143_6.text: Unless the shareholders otherwise resolve at a meeting called under subsection (4), the corporation shall reimburse the shareholders the expenses reasonably incurred by them in requisitioning, calling and holding the meeting.

cbca_s144_1.text: A court, on the application of a director, a shareholder who is entitled to vote at a meeting of shareholders or the Director, may order a meeting of a corporation to be called, held and conducted in the manner that the court directs, if

cbca_s144_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s144_1_a.text: it is impracticable to call the meeting within the time or in the manner in which those meetings are to be called;

cbca_s144_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s144_1_b.text: it is impracticable to conduct the meeting in the manner required by this Act or the by-laws; or

cbca_s144_1_c.label: (c)
cbca_s144_1_c.text: the court thinks that the meeting should be called, held and conducted within the time or in the manner it directs for any other reason.

cbca_s144_2.title: Varying quorum
cbca_s144_2.text: Without restricting the generality of subsection (1), the court may order that the quorum required by the by-laws or this Act be varied or dispensed with at a meeting called, held and conducted pursuant to this section.

cbca_s144_3.title: Valid meeting
cbca_s144_3.text: A meeting called, held and conducted pursuant to this section is for all purposes a meeting of shareholders of the corporation duly called, held and conducted.

cbca_s145_1.text: A corporation or a shareholder or director may apply to a court to determine any controversy with respect to an election or appointment of a director or auditor of the corporation.

cbca_s145_2.title: Powers of court
cbca_s145_2.text: On an application under this section, the court may make any order it thinks fit including, without limiting the generality of the foregoing,

cbca_s145_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s145_2_a.text: an order restraining a director or auditor whose election or appointment is challenged from acting pending determination of the dispute;

cbca_s145_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s145_2_b.text: an order declaring the result of the disputed election or appointment;

cbca_s145_2_c.label: (c)
cbca_s145_2_c.text: an order requiring a new election or appointment, and including in the order directions for the management of the business and affairs of the corporation until a new election is held or appointment made; and

cbca_s145_2_d.label: (d)
cbca_s145_2_d.text: an order determining the voting rights of shareholders and of persons claiming to own shares.

cbca_s145.1.title: Pooling agreement
cbca_s145.1.text: A written agreement between two or more shareholders may provide that in exercising voting rights the shares held by them shall be voted as provided in the agreement.

cbca_s146_1.text: An otherwise lawful written agreement among all the shareholders of a corporation, or among all the shareholders and one or more persons who are not shareholders, that restricts, in whole or in part, the powers of the directors to manage, or supervise the management of, the business and affairs of the corporation is valid.

cbca_s146_2.title: Declaration by single shareholder
cbca_s146_2.text: If a person who is the beneficial owner of all the issued shares of a corporation makes a written declaration that restricts in whole or in part the powers of the directors to manage, or supervise the management of, the business and affairs of the corporation, the declaration is deemed to be a unanimous shareholder agreement.

cbca_s146_3.title: Constructive party
cbca_s146_3.text: A purchaser or transferee of shares subject to a unanimous shareholder agreement is deemed to be a party to the agreement.

cbca_s146_4.title: When no notice given
cbca_s146_4.text: If notice is not given to a purchaser or transferee of the existence of a unanimous shareholder agreement, in the manner referred to in subsection 49(8) or otherwise, the purchaser or transferee may, no later than 30 days after they become aware of the existence of the unanimous shareholder agreement, rescind the transaction by which they acquired the shares.

cbca_s146_5.title: Rights of shareholder
cbca_s146_5.text: To the extent that a unanimous shareholder agreement restricts the powers of the directors to manage, or supervise the management of, the business and affairs of the corporation, parties to the unanimous shareholder agreement who are given that power to manage or supervise the management of the business and affairs of the corporation have all the rights, powers, duties and liabilities of a director of the corporation, whether they arise under this Act or otherwise, including any defences available to the directors, and the directors are relieved of their rights, powers, duties and liabilities, including their liabilities under section 119, to the same extent.

cbca_s146_6.title: Discretion of shareholders
cbca_s146_6.text: Nothing in this section prevents shareholders from fettering their discretion when exercising the powers of directors under a unanimous shareholder agreement.

cbca_s148_1.text: A shareholder entitled to vote at a meeting of shareholders may by means of a proxy appoint a proxyholder or one or more alternate proxyholders who are not required to be shareholders, to attend and act at the meeting in the manner and to the extent authorized by the proxy and with the authority conferred by the proxy.

cbca_s148_2.title: Execution or signing of proxy
cbca_s148_2.text: A proxy shall be executed or, in Quebec, signed by the shareholder or by the shareholder’s personal representative authorized in writing.

cbca_s148_3.title: Validity of proxy
cbca_s148_3.text: A proxy is valid only at the meeting in respect of which it is given or any adjournment thereof.

cbca_s148_4.title: Revocation of proxy
cbca_s148_4.text: A shareholder may revoke a proxy

cbca_s148_4_a.label: (a)
cbca_s148_4_a.text: by depositing an instrument or act in writing executed or, in Quebec, signed by the shareholder or by the shareholder’s personal representative authorized in writing

cbca_s148_4_a_i.label: (i)
cbca_s148_4_a_i.text: at the registered office of the corporation at any time up to and including the last business day preceding the day of the meeting, or an adjournment thereof, at which the proxy is to be used, or

cbca_s148_4_a_ii.label: (ii)
cbca_s148_4_a_ii.text: with the chairman of the meeting on the day of the meeting or an adjournment thereof; or

cbca_s148_4_b.label: (b)
cbca_s148_4_b.text: in any other manner permitted by law.

cbca_s148_5.title: Deposit of proxies
cbca_s148_5.text: The directors may specify in a notice calling a meeting of shareholders a time not more than 48 hours, excluding Saturdays and holidays, before the meeting or adjournment before which time proxies to be used at the meeting must be deposited with the corporation or its agent or mandatary.

cbca_s149_1.text: Subject to subsection (2), the management of a corporation shall, concurrently with giving notice of a meeting of shareholders, send a form of proxy in prescribed form to each shareholder who is entitled to receive notice of the meeting.

cbca_s149_2.title: Exception
cbca_s149_2.text: The management of the corporation is not required to send a form of proxy under subsection (1) if it

cbca_s149_2_a.label: (a)
