cbca_s190_25_a.text: withdraw their notice of dissent, in which case the corporation is deemed to consent to the withdrawal and the shareholder is reinstated to their full rights as a shareholder; or

cbca_s190_25_b.label: (b)
cbca_s190_25_b.text: retain a status as a claimant against the corporation, to be paid as soon as the corporation is lawfully able to do so or, in a liquidation, to be ranked subordinate to the rights of creditors of the corporation but in priority to its shareholders.

cbca_s190_26.title: Limitation
cbca_s190_26.text: A corporation shall not make a payment to a dissenting shareholder under this section if there are reasonable grounds for believing that

cbca_s190_26_a.label: (a)
cbca_s190_26_a.text: the corporation is or would after the payment be unable to pay its liabilities as they become due; or

cbca_s190_26_b.label: (b)
cbca_s190_26_b.text: the realizable value of the corporation’s assets would thereby be less than the aggregate of its liabilities.

cbca_s191_1.text: In this section, reorganization means a court order made under

cbca_s191_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s191_1_b.text: the Bankruptcy and Insolvency Act approving a proposal; or

cbca_s191_1_c.label: (c)
cbca_s191_1_c.text: any other Act of Parliament that affects the rights among the corporation, its shareholders and creditors.

cbca_s191_2.title: Powers of court
cbca_s191_2.text: If a corporation is subject to an order referred to in subsection (1), its articles may be amended by such order to effect any change that might lawfully be made by an amendment under section 173.

cbca_s191_3.title: Further powers
cbca_s191_3.text: If a court makes an order referred to in subsection (1), the court may also

cbca_s191_3_a.label: (a)
cbca_s191_3_a.text: authorize the issue of debt obligations of the corporation, whether or not convertible into shares of any class or having attached any rights or options to acquire shares of any class, and fix the terms thereof; and

cbca_s191_3_b.label: (b)
cbca_s191_3_b.text: appoint directors in place of or in addition to all or any of the directors then in office.

cbca_s191_4.title: Articles of reorganization
cbca_s191_4.text: After an order referred to in subsection (1) has been made, articles of reorganization in the form that the Director fixes shall be sent to the Director together with the documents required by sections 19 and 113, if applicable.

cbca_s191_5.title: Certificate of reorganization
cbca_s191_5.text: On receipt of articles of reorganization, the Director shall issue a certificate of amendment in accordance with section 262.

cbca_s191_6.title: Effect of certificate
cbca_s191_6.text: A reorganization becomes effective on the date shown in the certificate of amendment and the articles of incorporation are amended accordingly.

cbca_s191_7.title: No dissent
cbca_s191_7.text: A shareholder is not entitled to dissent under section 190 if an amendment to the articles of incorporation is effected under this section.

cbca_s192_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s192_1_a.text: an amendment to the articles of a corporation;

cbca_s192_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s192_1_b.text: an amalgamation of two or more corporations;

cbca_s192_1_c.label: (c)
cbca_s192_1_c.text: an amalgamation of a body corporate with a corporation that results in an amalgamated corporation subject to this Act;

cbca_s192_1_d.label: (d)
cbca_s192_1_d.text: a division of the business carried on by a corporation;

cbca_s192_1_e.label: (e)
cbca_s192_1_e.text: a transfer of all or substantially all the property of a corporation to another body corporate in exchange for property, money or securities of the body corporate;

cbca_s192_1_f.label: (f)
cbca_s192_1_f.text: an exchange of securities of a corporation for property, money or other securities of the corporation or property, money or securities of another body corporate;

cbca_s192_1_f.1.label: (f.1)
cbca_s192_1_f.1.text: a going-private transaction or a squeeze-out transaction in relation to a corporation;

cbca_s192_1_g.label: (g)
cbca_s192_1_g.text: a liquidation and dissolution of a corporation; and

cbca_s192_2.title: Where corporation insolvent
cbca_s192_2.text: For the purposes of this section, a corporation is insolvent

cbca_s192_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s192_2_a.text: where it is unable to pay its liabilities as they become due; or

cbca_s192_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s192_2_b.text: where the realizable value of the assets of the corporation are less than the aggregate of its liabilities and stated capital of all classes.

cbca_s192_3.title: Application to court for approval of arrangement
cbca_s192_3.text: Where it is not practicable for a corporation that is not insolvent to effect a fundamental change in the nature of an arrangement under any other provision of this Act, the corporation may apply to a court for an order approving an arrangement proposed by the corporation.

cbca_s192_4.title: Powers of court
cbca_s192_4.text: In connection with an application under this section, the court may make any interim or final order it thinks fit including, without limiting the generality of the foregoing,

cbca_s192_4_a.label: (a)
cbca_s192_4_a.text: an order determining the notice to be given to any interested person or dispensing with notice to any person other than the Director;

cbca_s192_4_b.label: (b)
cbca_s192_4_b.text: an order appointing counsel, at the expense of the corporation, to represent the interests of the shareholders;

cbca_s192_4_c.label: (c)
cbca_s192_4_c.text: an order requiring a corporation to call, hold and conduct a meeting of holders of securities or options or rights to acquire securities in such manner as the court directs;

cbca_s192_4_d.label: (d)
cbca_s192_4_d.text: an order permitting a shareholder to dissent under section 190; and

cbca_s192_4_e.label: (e)
cbca_s192_4_e.text: an order approving an arrangement as proposed by the corporation or as amended in any manner the court may direct.

cbca_s192_5.title: Notice to Director
cbca_s192_5.text: An applicant for any interim or final order under this section shall give the Director notice of the application and the Director is entitled to appear and be heard in person or by counsel.

cbca_s192_6.title: Articles of arrangement
cbca_s192_6.text: After an order referred to in paragraph (4)(e) has been made, articles of arrangement in the form that the Director fixes shall be sent to the Director together with the documents required by sections 19 and 113, if applicable.

cbca_s192_7.title: Certificate of arrangement
cbca_s192_7.text: On receipt of articles of arrangement, the Director shall issue a certificate of arrangement in accordance with section 262.

cbca_s192_8.title: Effect of certificate
cbca_s192_8.text: An arrangement becomes effective on the date shown in the certificate of arrangement.

cbca_s193.title: Going-private transactions
cbca_s193.text: A corporation may carry out a going-private transaction. However, if there are any applicable provincial securities laws, a corporation may not carry out a going-private transaction unless the corporation complies with those laws.

cbca_s194.title: Squeeze-out transactions
cbca_s194.text: A corporation may not carry out a squeeze-out transaction unless, in addition to any approval by holders of shares required by or under this Act or the articles of the corporation, the transaction is approved by ordinary resolution of the holders of each class of shares that are affected by the transaction, voting separately, whether or not the shares otherwise carry the right to vote. However, the following do not have the right to vote on the resolution:

cbca_s194_b.label: (b)
cbca_s194_b.text: holders of shares that would, following the squeeze-out transaction, be entitled to consideration of greater value or to superior rights or privileges than those available to other holders of shares of the same class.

cbca_s206_1.text: The definitions in this subsection apply in this Part.

cbca_s206_2.title: Right to acquire
cbca_s206_2.text: If within one hundred and twenty days after the date of a take-over bid the bid is accepted by the holders of not less than ninety per cent of the shares of any class of shares to which the take-over bid relates, other than shares held at the date of the take-over bid by or on behalf of the offeror or an affiliate or associate of the offeror, the offeror is entitled, on complying with this section, to acquire the shares held by the dissenting offerees.

cbca_s206_3.title: Notice
cbca_s206_3.text: An offeror may acquire shares held by a dissenting offeree by sending by registered mail within sixty days after the date of termination of the take-over bid and in any event within one hundred and eighty days after the date of the take-over bid, an offeror’s notice to each dissenting offeree and to the Director stating that

cbca_s206_3_a.label: (a)
cbca_s206_3_a.text: the offerees holding not less than ninety per cent of the shares to which the bid relates accepted the take-over bid;

cbca_s206_3_b.label: (b)
cbca_s206_3_b.text: the offeror is bound to take up and pay for or has taken up and paid for the shares of the offerees who accepted the take-over bid;

cbca_s206_3_c.label: (c)
cbca_s206_3_c.text: a dissenting offeree is required to elect

cbca_s206_3_c_i.label: (i)
cbca_s206_3_c_i.text: to transfer their shares to the offeror on the terms on which the offeror acquired the shares of the offerees who accepted the take-over bid, or

cbca_s206_3_c_ii.label: (ii)
cbca_s206_3_c_ii.text: to demand payment of the fair value of the shares in accordance with subsections (9) to (18) by notifying the offeror within twenty days after receiving the offeror’s notice;

cbca_s206_3_d.label: (d)
cbca_s206_3_d.text: a dissenting offeree who does not notify the offeror in accordance with subparagraph (5)(b)(ii) is deemed to have elected to transfer the shares to the offeror on the same terms that the offeror acquired the shares from the offerees who accepted the take-over bid; and

cbca_s206_3_e.label: (e)
cbca_s206_3_e.text: a dissenting offeree must send their shares to which the take-over bid relates to the offeree corporation within twenty days after receiving the offeror’s notice.

cbca_s206_4.title: Notice of adverse claim
cbca_s206_4.text: Concurrently with sending the offeror’s notice under subsection (3), the offeror shall send to the offeree corporation a notice of adverse claim in accordance with section 78 with respect to each share held by a dissenting offeree.

cbca_s206_5.title: Share certificate
cbca_s206_5.text: A dissenting offeree to whom an offeror’s notice is sent under subsection (3) shall, within twenty days after receiving the notice,

cbca_s206_5_a.label: (a)
cbca_s206_5_a.text: send the share certificates of the class of shares to which the take-over bid relates to the offeree corporation; and

cbca_s206_5_b_i.label: (i)
cbca_s206_5_b_i.text: to transfer the shares to the offeror on the terms on which the offeror acquired the shares of the offerees who accepted the take-over bid, or

cbca_s206_5_b_ii.label: (ii)
cbca_s206_5_b_ii.text: to demand payment of the fair value of the shares in accordance with subsections (9) to (18) by notifying the offeror within those twenty days.

cbca_s206_5.1.title: Deemed election
cbca_s206_5.1.text: A dissenting offeree who does not notify the offeror in accordance with subparagraph (5)(b)(ii) is deemed to have elected to transfer the shares to the offeror on the same terms on which the offeror acquired the shares from the offerees who accepted the take-over bid.

cbca_s206_6.title: Payment
cbca_s206_6.text: Within twenty days after the offeror sends an offeror’s notice under subsection (3), the offeror shall pay or transfer to the offeree corporation the amount of money or other consideration that the offeror would have had to pay or transfer to a dissenting offeree if the dissenting offeree had elected to accept the take-over bid under subparagraph (5)(b)(i).

cbca_s206_7.title: Consideration
cbca_s206_7.text: The offeree corporation is deemed to hold in trust for the dissenting shareholders the money or other consideration it receives under subsection (6), and the offeree corporation shall deposit the money in a separate account in a bank or other body corporate any of whose deposits are insured by the Canada Deposit Insurance Corporation or guaranteed by the Quebec Deposit Insurance Board, and shall place the other consideration in the custody of a bank or such other body corporate.

cbca_s206_7.1.title: When corporation is offeror
cbca_s206_7.1.text: A corporation that is an offeror making a take-over bid to repurchase all of the shares of a class of its shares is deemed to hold in trust for the dissenting shareholders the money and other consideration that it would have had to pay or transfer to a dissenting offeree if the dissenting offeree had elected to accept the take-over bid under subparagraph (5)(b)(i), and the corporation shall, within twenty days after a notice is sent under subsection (3), deposit the money in a separate account in a bank or other body corporate any of whose deposits are insured by the Canada Deposit Insurance Corporation or guaranteed by the Quebec Deposit Insurance Board, and shall place the other consideration in the custody of a bank or such other body corporate.

cbca_s206_8.title: Duty of offeree corporation
cbca_s206_8.text: Within thirty days after the offeror sends a notice under subsection (3), the offeree corporation shall

cbca_s206_8_a.label: (a)
cbca_s206_8_a.text: if the payment or transfer required by subsection (6) is made, issue to the offeror a share certificate in respect of the shares that were held by dissenting offerees;

cbca_s206_8_b.label: (b)
cbca_s206_8_b.text: give to each dissenting offeree who elects to accept the take-over bid terms under subparagraph (5)(b)(i) and who sends share certificates as required by paragraph (5)(a) the money or other consideration to which the offeree is entitled, disregarding fractional shares, which may be paid for in money; and

cbca_s206_8_c.label: (c)
cbca_s206_8_c.text: if the payment or transfer required by subsection (6) is made and the money or other consideration is deposited as required by subsection (7) or (7.1), send to each dissenting shareholder who has not sent share certificates as required by paragraph (5)(a) a notice stating that

cbca_s206_8_c_i.label: (i)
cbca_s206_8_c_i.text: the dissenting shareholder’s shares have been cancelled,

cbca_s206_8_c_ii.label: (ii)
cbca_s206_8_c_ii.text: the offeree corporation or some designated person holds in trust for the dissenting shareholder the money or other consideration to which that shareholder is entitled as payment for or in exchange for the shares, and

cbca_s206_8_c_iii.label: (iii)
cbca_s206_8_c_iii.text: the offeree corporation will, subject to subsections (9) to (18), send that money or other consideration to that shareholder without delay after receiving the shares.

cbca_s206_9.title: Application to court
cbca_s206_9.text: If a dissenting offeree has elected to demand payment of the fair value of the shares under subparagraph (5)(b)(ii), the offeror may, within twenty days after it has paid the money or transferred the other consideration under subsection (6), apply to a court to fix the fair value of the shares of that dissenting offeree.

cbca_s206_10.title: Idem
cbca_s206_10.text: If an offeror fails to apply to a court under subsection (9), a dissenting offeree may apply to a court for the same purpose within a further period of twenty days.

cbca_s206_11.title: Status of dissenter if no court application
cbca_s206_11.text: Where no application is made to a court under subsection (10) within the period set out in that subsection, a dissenting offeree is deemed to have elected to transfer their shares to the offeror on the same terms that the offeror acquired the shares from the offerees who accepted the take-over bid.

cbca_s206_12.title: Venue
cbca_s206_12.text: An application under subsection (9) or (10) shall be made to a court having jurisdiction in the place where the corporation has its registered office or in the province where the dissenting offeree resides if the corporation carries on business in that province.

cbca_s206_13.title: No security for costs
cbca_s206_13.text: A dissenting offeree is not required to give security for costs in an application made under subsection (9) or (10).

cbca_s206_14.title: Parties
cbca_s206_14.text: On an application under subsection (9) or (10)

cbca_s206_14_a.label: (a)
cbca_s206_14_a.text: all dissenting offerees referred to in subparagraph (5)(b)(ii) whose shares have not been acquired by the offeror shall be joined as parties and are bound by the decision of the court; and

cbca_s206_14_b.label: (b)
cbca_s206_14_b.text: the offeror shall notify each affected dissenting offeree of the date, place and consequences of the application and of their right to appear and be heard in person or by counsel.

cbca_s206_15.title: Powers of court
cbca_s206_15.text: On an application to a court under subsection (9) or (10), the court may determine whether any other person is a dissenting offeree who should be joined as a party, and the court shall then fix a fair value for the shares of all dissenting offerees.

cbca_s206_16.title: Appraisers
cbca_s206_16.text: A court may in its discretion appoint one or more appraisers to assist the court to fix a fair value for the shares of a dissenting offeree.

cbca_s206_17.title: Final order
cbca_s206_17.text: The final order of the court shall be made against the offeror in favour of each dissenting offeree and for the amount for the shares as fixed by the court.

cbca_s206_18.title: Additional powers
cbca_s206_18.text: In connection with proceedings under this section, a court may make any order it thinks fit and, without limiting the generality of the foregoing, it may

cbca_s206_18_a.label: (a)
cbca_s206_18_a.text: fix the amount of money or other consideration that is required to be held in trust under subsection (7) or (7.1);

cbca_s206_18_b.label: (b)
cbca_s206_18_b.text: order that that money or other consideration be held in trust by a person other than the offeree corporation;

cbca_s206_18_c.label: (c)
cbca_s206_18_c.text: allow a reasonable rate of interest on the amount payable to each dissenting offeree from the date they send or deliver their share certificates under subsection (5) until the date of payment; and

cbca_s206_18_d.label: (d)
cbca_s206_18_d.text: order that any money payable to a shareholder who cannot be found be paid to the Receiver General and subsection 227(3) applies in respect thereof.

cbca_s206.1_1.text: If a shareholder holding shares of a distributing corporation does not receive an offeror’s notice under subsection 206(3), the shareholder may

cbca_s206.1_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s206.1_1_a.text: within ninety days after the date of termination of the take-over bid, or

cbca_s206.1_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s206.1_1_b.text: if the shareholder did not receive an offer pursuant to the take-over bid, within ninety days after the later of

cbca_s206.1_1_b_i.label: (i)
cbca_s206.1_1_b_i.text: the date of termination of the take-over bid, and

cbca_s206.1_1_b_ii.label: (ii)
cbca_s206.1_1_b_ii.text: the date on which the shareholder learned of the take-over bid,

cbca_s206.1_2.title: Conditions
cbca_s206.1_2.text: If a shareholder requires the offeror to acquire shares under subsection (1), the offeror shall acquire the shares on the same terms under which the offeror acquired or will acquire the shares of the offerees who accepted the take-over bid.

cbca_s207.title: Definition of court
cbca_s207.text: In this Part, court means a court having jurisdiction in the place where the corporation has its registered office.

cbca_s208_1.text: This Part, other than sections 209 and 212, does not apply to a corporation that is an insolvent person or a bankrupt as those terms are defined in section 2 of the Bankruptcy and Insolvency Act.

cbca_s208_2.title: Staying proceedings
cbca_s208_2.text: Any proceedings taken under this Part to dissolve or to liquidate and dissolve a corporation shall be stayed if the corporation is at any time found, in a proceeding under the Bankruptcy and Insolvency Act, to be an insolvent person as defined in section 2 of that Act.

cbca_s209_1.text: When a corporation or other body corporate is dissolved under this Part, section 268 of this Act, section 261 of the Canada Business Corporations Act, chapter 33 of the Statutes of Canada, 1974-75-76, or subsection 297(6) of the Canada Not-for-profit Corporations Act, any interested person may apply to the Director to have the dissolved corporation or other body corporate revived as a corporation under this Act.

cbca_s209_2.title: Articles of revival
cbca_s209_2.text: Articles of revival in the form that the Director fixes shall be sent to the Director.

cbca_s209_3.title: Certificate of revival
cbca_s209_3.text: On receipt of articles of revival, the Director shall issue a certificate of revival in accordance with section 262, if

cbca_s209_3_a.label: (a)
cbca_s209_3_a.text: the dissolved corporation or other body corporate has fulfilled all conditions precedent that the Director considers reasonable; and

cbca_s209_3_b.label: (b)
cbca_s209_3_b.text: there is no valid reason for refusing to issue the certificate.

cbca_s209_3.1.title: Date of revival
cbca_s209_3.1.text: The dissolved corporation or other body corporate is revived as a corporation under this Act on the date shown on the certificate of revival.

cbca_s209_4.title: Rights and obligations preserved
cbca_s209_4.text: Subject to any reasonable terms that may be imposed by the Director, to the rights acquired by any person after its dissolution and to any changes to the internal affairs of the corporation or other body corporate after its dissolution, the revived corporation is, in the same manner and to the same extent as if it had not been dissolved,

cbca_s209_4_a.label: (a)
cbca_s209_4_a.text: restored to its previous position in law, including the restoration of any rights and privileges whether arising before its dissolution or after its dissolution and before its revival; and

cbca_s209_4_b.label: (b)
cbca_s209_4_b.text: liable for the obligations that it would have had if it had not been dissolved whether they arise before its dissolution or after its dissolution and before its revival.

cbca_s209_5.title: Legal actions
cbca_s209_5.text: Any legal action respecting the affairs of a revived corporation taken between the time of its dissolution and its revival is valid and effective.

cbca_s209_6.title: Definition of interested person
cbca_s209_6.text: In this section, interested person includes

cbca_s209_6_a.label: (a)
cbca_s209_6_a.text: a shareholder, a director, an officer, an employee and a creditor of the dissolved corporation or other body corporate;

cbca_s209_6_b.label: (b)
cbca_s209_6_b.text: a person who has a contract — other than, in Quebec, a contract by gratuitous title — with the dissolved corporation or other body corporate;

cbca_s209_6_c.label: (c)
cbca_s209_6_c.text: a person who, although at the time of dissolution of the corporation or other body corporate was not a person described in paragraph (a), would be such a person if a certificate of revival is issued under this section; and

cbca_s209_6_d.label: (d)
cbca_s209_6_d.text: a trustee in bankruptcy or liquidator for the dissolved corporation or other body corporate.

cbca_s210_1.text: A corporation that has not issued any shares may be dissolved at any time by resolution of all the directors.

cbca_s210_2.title: Dissolution if no property
cbca_s210_2.text: A corporation that has no property and no liabilities may be dissolved by special resolution of the shareholders or, where it has issued more than one class of shares, by special resolutions of the holders of each class whether or not they are otherwise entitled to vote.

cbca_s210_3.title: Dissolution where property disposed of
cbca_s210_3.text: A corporation that has property or liabilities or both may be dissolved by special resolution of the shareholders or, where it has issued more than one class of shares, by special resolutions of the holders of each class whether or not they are otherwise entitled to vote, if

cbca_s210_3_a.label: (a)
cbca_s210_3_a.text: by the special resolution or resolutions the shareholders authorize the directors to cause the corporation to distribute any property and discharge any liabilities; and

cbca_s210_3_b.label: (b)
cbca_s210_3_b.text: the corporation has distributed any property and discharged any liabilities before it sends articles of dissolution to the Director pursuant to subsection (4).

cbca_s210_4.title: Articles of dissolution
cbca_s210_4.text: Articles of dissolution in the form that the Director fixes shall be sent to the Director.

cbca_s210_5.title: Certificate of dissolution
cbca_s210_5.text: On receipt of articles of dissolution, the Director shall issue a certificate of dissolution in accordance with section 262.

cbca_s210_6.title: Effect of certificate
cbca_s210_6.text: The corporation ceases to exist on the date shown in the certificate of dissolution.

cbca_s211_1.text: The directors may propose, or a shareholder who is entitled to vote at an annual meeting of shareholders may, in accordance with section 137, make a proposal for, the voluntary liquidation and dissolution of a corporation.

cbca_s211_2.title: Notice of meeting
cbca_s211_2.text: Notice of any meeting of shareholders at which voluntary liquidation and dissolution is to be proposed shall set out the terms thereof.

cbca_s211_3.title: Shareholders resolution
cbca_s211_3.text: A corporation may liquidate and dissolve by special resolution of the shareholders or, where the corporation has issued more than one class of shares, by special resolutions of the holders of each class whether or not they are otherwise entitled to vote.

cbca_s211_4.title: Statement of intent to dissolve
cbca_s211_4.text: A statement of intent to dissolve in the form that the Director fixes shall be sent to the Director.

cbca_s211_5.title: Certificate of intent to dissolve
cbca_s211_5.text: On receipt of a statement of intent to dissolve, the Director shall issue a certificate of intent to dissolve in accordance with section 262.

cbca_s211_6.title: Effect of certificate
cbca_s211_6.text: On issue of a certificate of intent to dissolve, the corporation shall cease to carry on business except to the extent necessary for the liquidation, but its corporate existence continues until the Director issues a certificate of dissolution.

cbca_s211_7.title: Liquidation
cbca_s211_7.text: After issue of a certificate of intent to dissolve, the corporation shall

cbca_s211_7_a.label: (a)
cbca_s211_7_a.text: immediately cause notice thereof to be sent to each known creditor of the corporation;

cbca_s211_7_b.label: (b)
cbca_s211_7_b.text: without delay take reasonable steps to give notice of it in each province in Canada where the corporation was carrying on business at the time it sent the statement of intent to dissolve to the Director;

cbca_s211_7_c.label: (c)
cbca_s211_7_c.text: proceed to collect its property, to dispose of properties that are not to be distributed in kind to its shareholders, to discharge all its obligations and to do all other acts required to liquidate its business; and

cbca_s211_7_d.label: (d)
cbca_s211_7_d.text: after giving the notice required under paragraphs (a) and (b) and adequately providing for the payment or discharge of all its obligations, distribute its remaining property, either in money or in kind, among its shareholders according to their respective rights.

cbca_s211_8.title: Supervision by court
cbca_s211_8.text: The Director or any interested person may, at any time during the liquidation of a corporation, apply to a court for an order that the liquidation be continued under the supervision of the court as provided in this Part, and on such application the court may so order and make any further order it thinks fit.

cbca_s211_9.title: Notice to Director
cbca_s211_9.text: An applicant under this section shall give the Director notice of the application, and the Director is entitled to appear and be heard in person or by counsel.

cbca_s211_10.title: Revocation
cbca_s211_10.text: At any time after issue of a certificate of intent to dissolve and before issue of a certificate of dissolution, a certificate of intent to dissolve may be revoked by sending to the Director a statement of revocation of intent to dissolve in the form that the Director fixes, if such revocation is approved in the same manner as the resolution under subsection (3).

cbca_s211_11.title: Certificate of revocation of intent to dissolve
cbca_s211_11.text: On receipt of a statement of revocation of intent to dissolve, the Director shall issue a certificate of revocation of intent to dissolve in accordance with section 262.

cbca_s211_12.title: Effect of certificate
cbca_s211_12.text: On the date shown in the certificate of revocation of intent to dissolve, the revocation is effective and the corporation may continue to carry on its business or businesses.

cbca_s211_13.title: Right to dissolve
cbca_s211_13.text: If a certificate of intent to dissolve has not been revoked and the corporation has complied with subsection (7), the corporation shall prepare articles of dissolution.

cbca_s211_14.title: Articles of dissolution
cbca_s211_14.text: Articles of dissolution in the form that the Director fixes shall be sent to the Director.

cbca_s211_15.title: Certificate of dissolution
cbca_s211_15.text: On receipt of articles of dissolution, the Director shall issue a certificate of dissolution in accordance with section 262.

cbca_s211_16.title: Effect of certificate
cbca_s211_16.text: The corporation ceases to exist on the date shown in the certificate of dissolution.

cbca_s212_1.text: Subject to subsections (2) and (3), the Director may

cbca_s212_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s212_1_a.text: dissolve a corporation by issuing a certificate of dissolution under this section if the corporation

cbca_s212_1_a_i.label: (i)
cbca_s212_1_a_i.text: has not commenced business within three years after the date shown in its certificate of incorporation,

cbca_s212_1_a_ii.label: (ii)
cbca_s212_1_a_ii.text: has not carried on its business for three consecutive years,

cbca_s212_1_a_iii.label: (iii)
cbca_s212_1_a_iii.text: is in default for a period of one year in sending to the Director any fee or any notice, document or other information required by this Act, or

cbca_s212_1_a_iv.label: (iv)
cbca_s212_1_a_iv.text: does not have any directors or is in the situation described in subsection 109(4); or

cbca_s212_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s212_1_b.text: apply to a court for an order dissolving the corporation, in which case section 217 applies.

cbca_s212_2.title: Publication
cbca_s212_2.text: The Director shall not dissolve a corporation under this section until the Director has

cbca_s212_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s212_2_a.text: given one hundred and twenty days notice of the decision to dissolve the corporation to the corporation and to each director thereof; and

cbca_s212_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s212_2_b.text: published notice of that decision in a publication generally available to the public.

cbca_s212_3.title: Certificate of dissolution
cbca_s212_3.text: Unless cause to the contrary has been shown or an order has been made by a court under section 246, the Director may, after the expiration of the period referred to in subsection (2), issue a certificate of dissolution in the form that the Director fixes.

cbca_s212_3.1.title: Payment of incorporation fee or sending of information
cbca_s212_3.1.text: Despite anything in this section, the Director may dissolve a corporation by issuing a certificate of dissolution if the required fee for the issuance of a certificate of incorporation has not been paid or if the corporation has not complied with subsection 21.21(2).

cbca_s212_4.title: Effect of certificate
cbca_s212_4.text: The corporation ceases to exist on the date shown in the certificate of dissolution.

cbca_s213_1.text: The Director or any interested person may apply to a court for an order dissolving a corporation if the corporation has

cbca_s213_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s213_1_a.text: failed for two or more consecutive years to comply with the requirements of this Act with respect to the holding of annual meetings of shareholders;

cbca_s213_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s213_1_b.text: contravened subsection 16(2) or section 21, 157 or 159; or

cbca_s213_1_c.label: (c)
cbca_s213_1_c.text: procured any certificate under this Act by misrepresentation.

cbca_s213_2.title: Notice to Director
cbca_s213_2.text: An applicant under this section shall give the Director notice of the application, and the Director is entitled to appear and be heard in person or by counsel.

cbca_s213_3.title: Dissolution order
cbca_s213_3.text: On an application under this section or section 212, the court may order that the corporation be dissolved or that the corporation be liquidated and dissolved under the supervision of the court, and the court may make any other order it thinks fit.

cbca_s213_4.title: Certificate
cbca_s213_4.text: On receipt of an order under this section, section 212 or 214, the Director shall

cbca_s213_4_a.label: (a)
cbca_s213_4_a.text: if the order is to dissolve the corporation, issue a certificate of dissolution in the form that the Director fixes; or

cbca_s213_4_b.label: (b)
cbca_s213_4_b.text: if the order is to liquidate and dissolve the corporation under the supervision of the court, issue a certificate of intent to dissolve in the form that the Director fixes and publish notice of the order in a publication generally available to the public.

cbca_s213_5.title: Effect of certificate
cbca_s213_5.text: The corporation ceases to exist on the date shown in the certificate of dissolution.

cbca_s214_1.text: A court may order the liquidation and dissolution of a corporation or any of its affiliated corporations on the application of a shareholder,

cbca_s214_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s214_1_a.text: if the court is satisfied that in respect of a corporation or any of its affiliates

cbca_s214_1_a_i.label: (i)
cbca_s214_1_a_i.text: any act or omission of the corporation or any of its affiliates effects a result,

cbca_s214_1_a_ii.label: (ii)
cbca_s214_1_a_ii.text: the business or affairs of the corporation or any of its affiliates are or have been carried on or conducted in a manner, or

cbca_s214_1_a_iii.label: (iii)
cbca_s214_1_a_iii.text: the powers of the directors of the corporation or any of its affiliates are or have been exercised in a manner

cbca_s214_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s214_1_b.text: if the court is satisfied that

cbca_s214_1_b_i.label: (i)
cbca_s214_1_b_i.text: a unanimous shareholder agreement entitles a complaining shareholder to demand dissolution of the corporation after the occurrence of a specified event and that event has occurred, or

cbca_s214_1_b_ii.label: (ii)
cbca_s214_1_b_ii.text: it is just and equitable that the corporation should be liquidated and dissolved.

cbca_s214_2.title: Alternative order
cbca_s214_2.text: On an application under this section, a court may make such order under this section or section 241 as it thinks fit.

cbca_s214_3.title: Application of s. 242
cbca_s214_3.text: Section 242 applies to an application under this section.

cbca_s215_1.text: An application to a court to supervise a voluntary liquidation and dissolution under subsection 211(8) shall state the reasons, verified by an affidavit of the applicant, why the court should supervise the liquidation and dissolution.

cbca_s215_2.title: Court supervision
cbca_s215_2.text: If a court makes an order applied for under subsection 211(8), the liquidation and dissolution of the corporation shall continue under the supervision of the court in accordance with this Act.

cbca_s216_1.text: An application to a court under subsection 214(1) shall state the reasons, verified by an affidavit of the applicant, why the corporation should be liquidated and dissolved.

cbca_s216_2.title: Show cause order
cbca_s216_2.text: On an application under subsection 214(1), the court may make an order requiring the corporation and any person having an interest in the corporation or claim against it to show cause, at a time and place specified in the order, within four weeks after the date of the order, why the corporation should not be liquidated and dissolved.

cbca_s216_3.title: Powers of court
cbca_s216_3.text: On an application under subsection 214(1), the court may order the directors and officers of the corporation to furnish the court with all material information known to or reasonably ascertainable by them, including

cbca_s216_3_b.label: (b)
cbca_s216_3_b.text: the name and address of each shareholder of the corporation; and

cbca_s216_3_c.label: (c)
cbca_s216_3_c.text: the name and address of each known creditor or claimant, including any creditor or claimant with unliquidated, future or contingent claims, and any person with whom the corporation has a contract.

cbca_s216_4.title: Publication
cbca_s216_4.text: A copy of an order made under subsection (2) shall be

cbca_s216_4_a.label: (a)
cbca_s216_4_a.text: published as directed in the order, at least once in each week before the time appointed for the hearing, in a newspaper published or distributed in the place where the corporation has its registered office; and

cbca_s216_4_b.label: (b)
cbca_s216_4_b.text: served on the Director and each person named in the order.

cbca_s216_5.title: Person responsible
cbca_s216_5.text: Publication and service of an order under this section shall be effected by the corporation or by such other person and in such manner as the court may order.

cbca_s217.title: Powers of court
cbca_s217.text: In connection with the dissolution or the liquidation and dissolution of a corporation, the court may, if it is satisfied that the corporation is able to pay or adequately provide for the discharge of all its obligations, make any order it thinks fit including, without limiting the generality of the foregoing,

cbca_s217_b.label: (b)
cbca_s217_b.text: an order appointing a liquidator, with or without security, fixing the liquidator’s remuneration and replacing a liquidator;

cbca_s217_c.label: (c)
cbca_s217_c.text: an order appointing inspectors or referees, specifying their powers, fixing their remuneration and replacing inspectors or referees;

cbca_s217_d.label: (d)
cbca_s217_d.text: an order determining the notice to be given to any interested person, or dispensing with notice to any person;

cbca_s217_e.label: (e)
cbca_s217_e.text: an order determining the validity of any claims made against the corporation;

cbca_s217_f.label: (f)
cbca_s217_f.text: an order, at any stage of the proceedings, restraining the directors and officers from

cbca_s217_f_i.label: (i)
cbca_s217_f_i.text: exercising any of their powers, or

cbca_s217_f_ii.label: (ii)
cbca_s217_f_ii.text: collecting or receiving any debt or other property of the corporation, and from paying out or transferring any property of the corporation, except as permitted by the court;

cbca_s217_g.label: (g)
cbca_s217_g.text: an order determining and enforcing the duty or liability of any present or former director, officer or shareholder

cbca_s217_g_ii.label: (ii)
cbca_s217_g_ii.text: for an obligation of the corporation;

cbca_s217_h.label: (h)
cbca_s217_h.text: an order approving the payment, satisfaction or compromise of claims against the corporation and the retention of assets for such purpose, and determining the adequacy of provisions for the payment or discharge of obligations of the corporation, whether liquidated, unliquidated, future or contingent;

cbca_s217_i.label: (i)
cbca_s217_i.text: an order disposing of or destroying the documents and records of the corporation;

cbca_s217_j.label: (j)
cbca_s217_j.text: on the application of a creditor, the inspectors or the liquidator, an order giving directions on any matter arising in the liquidation;

cbca_s217_k.label: (k)
cbca_s217_k.text: after notice has been given to all interested parties, an order relieving a liquidator from any omission or default on such terms as the court thinks fit and confirming any act of the liquidator;

cbca_s217_l.label: (l)
cbca_s217_l.text: subject to section 223, an order approving any proposed interim or final distribution to shareholders in money or in property;

cbca_s217_m.label: (m)
cbca_s217_m.text: an order disposing of any property belonging to creditors or shareholders who cannot be found;

cbca_s217_n.label: (n)
cbca_s217_n.text: on the application of any director, officer, security holder, creditor or the liquidator,

cbca_s217_n_i.label: (i)
cbca_s217_n_i.text: an order staying the liquidation on such terms and conditions as the court thinks fit,

cbca_s217_n_ii.label: (ii)
cbca_s217_n_ii.text: an order continuing or discontinuing the liquidation proceedings, or

cbca_s217_n_iii.label: (iii)
cbca_s217_n_iii.text: an order to the liquidator to restore to the corporation all its remaining property; and

cbca_s217_o.label: (o)
cbca_s217_o.text: after the liquidator has rendered a final account to the court, an order dissolving the corporation.

cbca_s218.title: Effect of order
cbca_s218.text: The liquidation of a corporation commences when a court makes an order therefor.

cbca_s219_1.text: If a court makes an order for liquidation of a corporation,

cbca_s219_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s219_1_a.text: the corporation continues in existence but shall cease to carry on business, except the business that is, in the opinion of the liquidator, required for an orderly liquidation; and

cbca_s219_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s219_1_b.text: the powers of the directors and shareholders cease and vest in the liquidator, except as specifically authorized by the court.

cbca_s219_2.title: Delegation by liquidator
cbca_s219_2.text: The liquidator may delegate any powers vested in the liquidator by paragraph (1)(b) to the directors or shareholders.

cbca_s220_1.text: When making an order for the liquidation of a corporation or at any time thereafter, the court may appoint any person, including a director, an officer or a shareholder of the corporation or any other body corporate, as liquidator of the corporation.

cbca_s220_2.title: Vacancy
cbca_s220_2.text: Where an order for the liquidation of a corporation has been made and the office of liquidator is or becomes vacant, the property of the corporation is under the control of the court until the office of liquidator is filled.

cbca_s221_a.label: (a)
cbca_s221_a.text: forthwith after appointment give notice thereof to the Director and to each claimant and creditor known to the liquidator;

cbca_s221_b.label: (b)
cbca_s221_b.text: without delay publish notice by insertion once a week for two consecutive weeks in a newspaper published or distributed in the place where the corporation has its registered office and take reasonable steps to give notice of the appointment in each province where the corporation carries on business, requiring any person

cbca_s221_b_i.label: (i)
cbca_s221_b_i.text: indebted to the corporation, to render an account and pay to the liquidator at the time and place specified any amount owing,

cbca_s221_b_ii.label: (ii)
cbca_s221_b_ii.text: possessing property of the corporation, to deliver it to the liquidator at the time and place specified, and

cbca_s221_b_iii.label: (iii)
cbca_s221_b_iii.text: having a claim against the corporation, whether liquidated, unliquidated, future or contingent, to present particulars thereof in writing to the liquidator not later than two months after the first publication of the notice;

cbca_s221_c.label: (c)
cbca_s221_c.text: take into custody and control the property of the corporation;

cbca_s221_d.label: (d)
cbca_s221_d.text: open and maintain a trust account for the moneys of the corporation;

cbca_s221_e.label: (e)
cbca_s221_e.text: keep accounts of the moneys of the corporation received and paid out by the liquidator;

cbca_s221_f.label: (f)
cbca_s221_f.text: maintain separate lists of the shareholders, creditors and other persons having claims against the corporation;

cbca_s221_g.label: (g)
cbca_s221_g.text: if at any time the liquidator determines that the corporation is unable to pay or adequately provide for the discharge of its obligations, apply to the court for directions;

cbca_s221_h.label: (h)
cbca_s221_h.text: deliver to the court and to the Director, at least once in every twelve month period after appointment or more often as the court may require, financial statements of the corporation in the form required by section 155 or in such other form as the liquidator may think proper or as the court may require; and

cbca_s221_i.label: (i)
cbca_s221_i.text: after the final accounts are approved by the court, distribute any remaining property of the corporation among the shareholders according to their respective rights.

cbca_s222_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s222_1_a.text: retain lawyers, accountants, engineers, appraisers and other professional advisers;

cbca_s222_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s222_1_b.text: bring, defend or take part in any civil, criminal or administrative action or proceeding in the name and on behalf of the corporation;

cbca_s222_1_c.label: (c)
cbca_s222_1_c.text: carry on the business of the corporation as required for an orderly liquidation;

cbca_s222_1_d.label: (d)
cbca_s222_1_d.text: sell by public auction or private sale any property of the corporation;

cbca_s222_1_e.label: (e)
cbca_s222_1_e.text: do all acts and execute or, in Quebec, sign any documents in the name and on behalf of the corporation;

cbca_s222_1_f.label: (f)
cbca_s222_1_f.text: borrow money on the security of the property of the corporation;

cbca_s222_1_g.label: (g)
cbca_s222_1_g.text: settle or compromise any claims by or against the corporation; and

cbca_s222_1_h.label: (h)
cbca_s222_1_h.text: do all other things necessary for the liquidation of the corporation and distribution of its property.

cbca_s222_2.title: Due diligence
cbca_s222_2.text: A liquidator is not liable if the liquidator exercised the care, diligence and skill that a reasonably prudent person would have exercised in comparable circumstances, including reliance in good faith on

cbca_s222_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s222_2_a.text: financial statements of the corporation represented to the liquidator by an officer of the corporation or in a written report of the auditor of the corporation fairly to reflect the financial condition of the corporation; or

cbca_s222_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s222_2_b.text: a report of a person whose profession lends credibility to a statement made by the professional person.

cbca_s222_3.title: Application for examination
cbca_s222_3.text: If a liquidator has reason to believe that any person has in their possession or under their control, or has concealed, withheld or misappropriated any property of the corporation, the liquidator may apply to the court for an order requiring that person to appear before the court at the time and place designated in the order and to be examined.

cbca_s222_4.title: Power of court
cbca_s222_4.text: If the examination referred to in subsection (3) discloses that a person has concealed, withheld or misappropriated property of the corporation, the court may order that person to restore it or pay compensation to the liquidator.

cbca_s223_1.text: A liquidator shall pay the costs of liquidation out of the property of the corporation and shall pay or make adequate provision for all claims against the corporation.

cbca_s223_2.title: Final accounts
cbca_s223_2.text: Within one year after appointment, and after paying or making adequate provision for all claims against the corporation, the liquidator shall apply to the court

cbca_s223_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s223_2_a.text: for approval of the final accounts and for an order permitting the liquidator to distribute in money or in kind the remaining property of the corporation to its shareholders according to their respective rights; or

cbca_s223_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s223_2_b.text: for an extension of time, setting out the reasons therefor.

cbca_s223_3.title: Shareholder application
cbca_s223_3.text: If a liquidator fails to make the application required by subsection (2), a shareholder of the corporation may apply to the court for an order for the liquidator to show cause why a final accounting and distribution should not be made.

cbca_s223_4.title: Publication
cbca_s223_4.text: A liquidator shall give notice of their intention to make an application under subsection (2) to the Director, to each inspector appointed under section 217, to each shareholder and to any person who provided a security, fidelity bond or fidelity insurance for the liquidation, and shall publish the notice in a newspaper published or distributed in the place where the corporation has its registered office, or as otherwise directed by the court.

cbca_s223_5.title: Final order
cbca_s223_5.text: If the court approves the final accounts rendered by a liquidator, the court shall make an order

cbca_s223_5_a.label: (a)
cbca_s223_5_a.text: directing the Director to issue a certificate of dissolution;

cbca_s223_5_b.label: (b)
cbca_s223_5_b.text: directing the custody or disposal of the documents and records of the corporation; and

cbca_s223_5_c.label: (c)
cbca_s223_5_c.text: subject to subsection (6), discharging the liquidator.

cbca_s223_6.title: Delivery of order
cbca_s223_6.text: The liquidator shall forthwith send a certified copy of the order referred to in subsection (5) to the Director.

cbca_s223_7.title: Certificate of dissolution
cbca_s223_7.text: On receipt of the order referred to in subsection (5), the Director shall issue a certificate of dissolution in accordance with section 262.

cbca_s223_8.title: Effect of certificate
cbca_s223_8.text: The corporation ceases to exist on the date shown in the certificate of dissolution.

cbca_s224_1.text: If in the course of liquidation of a corporation the shareholders resolve or the liquidator proposes to

cbca_s224_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s224_1_a.text: exchange all or substantially all the property of the corporation for securities of another body corporate that are to be distributed to the shareholders, or

cbca_s224_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s224_1_b.text: distribute all or part of the property of the corporation to the shareholders in kind,

cbca_s224_2.title: Powers of court
cbca_s224_2.text: On an application under subsection (1), the court may order

cbca_s224_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s224_2_a.text: all the property of the corporation to be converted into and distributed in money; or

cbca_s224_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s224_2_b.text: the claims of any shareholder applying under this section to be satisfied by a distribution in money, in which case subsections 190(20) to (22) apply.

cbca_s225_1.text: A person who has been granted custody of the documents and records of a dissolved corporation remains liable to produce those documents and records until the end of the prescribed period or of any shorter period fixed by an order made under subsection 223(5).

cbca_s225_2.title: Offence
cbca_s225_2.text: A person who, without reasonable cause, contravenes subsection (1) is guilty of an offence and liable on summary conviction to a fine not exceeding five thousand dollars or to imprisonment for a term not exceeding six months or to both.

cbca_s226_1.text: In this section, shareholder includes the heirs and personal representatives of a shareholder.

cbca_s226_2.title: Continuation of actions
cbca_s226_2.text: Notwithstanding the dissolution of a body corporate under this Act,

cbca_s226_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s226_2_a.text: a civil, criminal or administrative action or proceeding commenced by or against the body corporate before its dissolution may be continued as if the body corporate had not been dissolved;

cbca_s226_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s226_2_b.text: a civil, criminal or administrative action or proceeding may be brought against the body corporate within two years after its dissolution as if the body corporate had not been dissolved; and

cbca_s226_2_c.label: (c)
cbca_s226_2_c.text: any property that would have been available to satisfy any judgment or order if the body corporate had not been dissolved remains available for such purpose.

cbca_s226_3.title: Service
cbca_s226_3.text: Service of a document on a corporation after its dissolution may be effected by serving the document on a person shown in the last notice filed under section 106 or 113.

cbca_s226_3.1.title: Idem
cbca_s226_3.1.text: Service of a document on a company to which the Canada Corporations Act, chapter C-32 of the Revised Statutes of Canada, 1970, applied that has been dissolved by subsection 261(8) of the Canada Business Corporations Act, chapter 33 of the Statutes of Canada, 1974-75-76 and chapter 9 of the Statutes of Canada, 1978-79, may be effected by serving the document on a person shown as a director in the last annual summary filed by the company pursuant to the Canada Corporations Act.

cbca_s226_4.title: Reimbursement
cbca_s226_4.text: Notwithstanding the dissolution of a body corporate under this Act, a shareholder to whom any of its property has been distributed is liable to any person claiming under subsection (2) to the extent of the amount received by that shareholder on such distribution, and an action to enforce such liability may be brought within two years after the date of the dissolution of the body corporate.

cbca_s226_5.title: Representative action
cbca_s226_5.text: A court may order an action referred to in subsection (4) to be brought against the persons who were shareholders as a class, subject to such conditions as the court thinks fit and, if the plaintiff establishes a claim, the court may refer the proceedings to a referee or other officer of the court who may

cbca_s226_5_a.label: (a)
cbca_s226_5_a.text: add as a party to the proceedings each person who was a shareholder found by the plaintiff;

cbca_s226_5_b.label: (b)
cbca_s226_5_b.text: determine, subject to subsection (4), the amount that each person who was a shareholder shall contribute towards satisfaction of the plaintiff’s claim; and

cbca_s226_5_c.label: (c)
cbca_s226_5_c.text: direct payment of the amounts so determined.

cbca_s227_1.text: On the dissolution of a body corporate under this Act, the portion of the property distributable to a creditor or shareholder who cannot be found shall be converted into money and paid to the Receiver General.

cbca_s227_2.title: Constructive satisfaction
cbca_s227_2.text: A payment under subsection (1) is deemed to be in satisfaction of a debt or claim of such creditor or shareholder.

cbca_s227_3.title: Recovery
cbca_s227_3.text: A person who establishes an entitlement to any moneys paid to the Receiver General under this Act shall be paid by the Receiver General an equivalent amount out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund.

cbca_s228_1.text: Subject to subsection 226(2) and section 227, property of a body corporate that has not been disposed of at the date of its dissolution under this Act vests in Her Majesty in right of Canada.

cbca_s228_2.title: Return of property on revival
cbca_s228_2.text: If a body corporate is revived as a corporation under section 209, any property, other than money, that vested in Her Majesty pursuant to subsection (1), that has not been disposed of shall be returned to the corporation and there shall be paid to the corporation out of the Consolidated Revenue Fund

cbca_s228_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s228_2_a.text: an amount equal to any money received by Her Majesty pursuant to subsection (1); and

cbca_s228_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s228_2_b.text: where property other than money vested in Her Majesty pursuant to subsection (1) and that property has been disposed of, an amount equal to the lesser of

cbca_s228_2_b_i.label: (i)
cbca_s228_2_b_i.text: the value of any such property at the date it vested in Her Majesty, and

cbca_s228_2_b_ii.label: (ii)
cbca_s228_2_b_ii.text: the amount realized by Her Majesty from the disposition of that property.

cbca_s229_1.text: A security holder or the Director may apply, ex parte or on such notice as the court may require, to a court having jurisdiction in the place where the corporation has its registered office for an order directing an investigation to be made of the corporation and any of its affiliated corporations.

cbca_s229_2.title: Grounds
cbca_s229_2.text: If, on an application under subsection (1), it appears to the court that

cbca_s229_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s229_2_a.text: the business of the corporation or any of its affiliates is or has been carried on with intent to defraud any person,

cbca_s229_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s229_2_b.text: the business or affairs of the corporation or any of its affiliates are or have been carried on or conducted, or the powers of the directors are or have been exercised in a manner that is oppressive or unfairly prejudicial to or that unfairly disregards the interests of a security holder,

cbca_s229_2_c.label: (c)
cbca_s229_2_c.text: the corporation or any of its affiliates was formed for a fraudulent or unlawful purpose or is to be dissolved for a fraudulent or unlawful purpose, or

cbca_s229_2_d.label: (d)
cbca_s229_2_d.text: persons concerned with the formation, business or affairs of the corporation or any of its affiliates have in connection therewith acted fraudulently or dishonestly,

cbca_s229_3.title: Notice to Director
cbca_s229_3.text: A security holder who makes an application under subsection (1) shall give the Director reasonable notice thereof and the Director is entitled to appear and be heard in person or by counsel.

cbca_s229_4.title: No security for costs
cbca_s229_4.text: An applicant under this section is not required to give security for costs.

cbca_s229_5.title: Hearings in camera
cbca_s229_5.text: An ex parte application under this section shall be heard in camera.

cbca_s229_6.title: Consent to publish proceedings required
cbca_s229_6.text: No person may publish anything relating to ex parte proceedings under this section except with the authorization of the court or the written consent of the corporation being investigated.

cbca_s230_1.text: In connection with an investigation under this Part, the court may make any order it thinks fit including, without limiting the generality of the foregoing,

cbca_s230_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s230_1_b.text: an order appointing an inspector, who may be the Director, fixing the remuneration of an inspector, and replacing an inspector;

cbca_s230_1_c.label: (c)
cbca_s230_1_c.text: an order determining the notice to be given to any interested person, or dispensing with notice to any person;

cbca_s230_1_d.label: (d)
cbca_s230_1_d.text: an order authorizing an inspector to enter any premises in which the court is satisfied there might be relevant information, and to examine any thing and make copies of any document or record found on the premises;

cbca_s230_1_e.label: (e)
cbca_s230_1_e.text: an order requiring any person to produce documents or records to the inspector;

cbca_s230_1_f.label: (f)
cbca_s230_1_f.text: an order authorizing an inspector to conduct a hearing, administer oaths, and examine any person on oath, and prescribing rules for the conduct of the hearing;

cbca_s230_1_g.label: (g)
cbca_s230_1_g.text: an order requiring any person to attend a hearing conducted by an inspector and to give evidence on oath;

cbca_s230_1_h.label: (h)
cbca_s230_1_h.text: an order giving directions to an inspector or any interested person on any matter arising in the investigation;

cbca_s230_1_i.label: (i)
cbca_s230_1_i.text: an order requiring an inspector to make an interim or final report to the court;

cbca_s230_1_j.label: (j)
cbca_s230_1_j.text: an order determining whether a report of an inspector should be published and, if so, ordering the Director to publish the report in whole or in part or to send copies to any person the court designates;

cbca_s230_1_k.label: (k)
cbca_s230_1_k.text: an order requiring an inspector to discontinue an investigation; and

cbca_s230_1_l.label: (l)
cbca_s230_1_l.text: an order requiring the corporation to pay the costs of the investigation.

cbca_s230_2.title: Copy of report
cbca_s230_2.text: An inspector shall send to the Director a copy of every report made by the inspector under this Part.

cbca_s231_1.text: An inspector under this Part has the powers set out in the order appointing him.

cbca_s231_2.title: Exchange of information
cbca_s231_2.text: In addition to the powers set out in the order appointing him, an inspector appointed to investigate a corporation may furnish to, or exchange information and otherwise cooperate with, any public official in Canada or elsewhere who is authorized to exercise investigatory powers and who is investigating, in respect of the corporation, any allegation of improper conduct that is the same as or similar to the conduct described in subsection 229(2).

cbca_s231_3.title: Court order
cbca_s231_3.text: An inspector shall on request produce to an interested person a copy of any order made under subsection 230(1).

cbca_s232_1.text: Any interested person may apply to the court for an order that a hearing conducted by an inspector under this Part be heard in camera and for directions on any matter arising in the investigation.

cbca_s232_2.title: Right to counsel
cbca_s232_2.text: A person whose conduct is being investigated or who is being examined at a hearing conducted by an inspector under this Part has a right to be represented by counsel.

cbca_s233.title: Criminating statements
cbca_s233.text: No person is excused from attending and giving evidence and producing documents and records to an inspector under this Part by reason only that the evidence tends to criminate that person or subject that person to any proceeding or penalty, but no such evidence shall be used or is receivable against that person in any proceeding thereafter instituted against that person under an Act of Parliament, other than a prosecution under section 132 of the Criminal Code for perjury in giving the evidence or a prosecution under section 136 of the Criminal Code in respect of the evidence.

cbca_s234.title: Absolute privilege (defamation)
cbca_s234.text: Any oral or written statement or report made by an inspector or any other person in an investigation under this Part has absolute privilege.

cbca_s235_1.text: If the Director is satisfied that, for the purposes of Part XI, XIII or XVII, or for the purposes of enforcing any regulation made under section 174, there is reason to inquire into the ownership or control of a security of a corporation or any of its affiliates, the Director may require any person that the Director reasonably believes has or has had an interest or right in the security or acts or has acted on behalf of a person with such an interest or right to report to him or her or to any person the Director designates

cbca_s235_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s235_1_a.text: information that the person has or can reasonably be expected to obtain as to present and past interests or rights in the security; and

cbca_s235_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s235_1_b.text: the names and addresses of the persons with such an interest or right and of any person who acts or has acted in relation to the security on their behalf.

cbca_s235_2.title: Presumption
cbca_s235_2.text: For the purposes of subsection (1), a person is deemed to have an interest or right in a security if

cbca_s235_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s235_2_a.text: the person has a right to vote or to acquire or dispose of the security or any interest or right in it;

cbca_s235_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s235_2_b.text: the person’s consent is necessary for the exercise of the rights or privileges of any other person with an interest or right in the security; or

cbca_s235_2_c.label: (c)
cbca_s235_2_c.text: any other person with an interest or right in the security can be required or is accustomed to exercise rights or privileges attached to the security in accordance with the person’s instructions.

cbca_s235_3.title: Publication
cbca_s235_3.text: The Director shall publish in a publication generally available to the public the particulars of information obtained by the Director under this section, if the particulars

cbca_s235_3_a.label: (a)
cbca_s235_3_a.text: are required to be disclosed by this Act or the regulations; and

cbca_s235_3_b.label: (b)
cbca_s235_3_b.text: have not previously been so disclosed.

cbca_s235_4.title: Offence
cbca_s235_4.text: A person who fails to comply with this section is guilty of an offence and liable on summary conviction to a fine not exceeding five thousand dollars or to imprisonment for a term not exceeding six months or to both.

cbca_s235_5.title: Officers, etc., of bodies corporate
cbca_s235_5.text: Where a body corporate commits an offence under subsection (4), any director or officer of the body corporate who knowingly authorized, permitted or acquiesced in the commission of the offence is a party to and guilty of the offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine not exceeding five thousand dollars or to imprisonment for a term not exceeding six months or to both, whether or not the body corporate has been prosecuted or convicted.

cbca_s236.title: Solicitor-client privilege or professional secrecy
cbca_s236.text: Nothing in this Part shall be construed as affecting solicitor-client privilege or, in Quebec, the professional secrecy of advocates and notaries.

cbca_s237_1.text: The Director may make inquiries of any person relating to compliance with this Act and may, as part of any inquiry, require the person to provide any records or other documents or information.

cbca_s237_2.title: Response
cbca_s237_2.text: A person shall respond to any inquiry made under subsection (1).

cbca_part_xix_heading_interpretation_and.title: Interpretation and Application
cbca_part_xix_heading_interpretation_and.full_citation: CBCA PART XIX.1 - Interpretation and Application

cbca_s237.1.title: Definitions
cbca_s237.1.text: The definitions in this section apply in this Part.

cbca_s237.2_1.text: This Part applies to the apportionment of damages awarded to a plaintiff for financial loss after a court has found more than one defendant or third party responsible for the financial loss.

cbca_s237.2_2.title: Non-application of Part
cbca_s237.2_2.text: This Part does not apply to an award of damages to any of the following plaintiffs:

cbca_s237.2_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s237.2_2_a.text: Her Majesty in right of Canada or of a province;

cbca_s237.2_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s237.2_2_b.text: an agent of Her Majesty in right of Canada or of a province or a federal or provincial Crown corporation or government agency, unless a substantial part of its activities involves trading, including making investments in, securities or other financial instruments;

cbca_s237.2_2_c.label: (c)
cbca_s237.2_2_c.text: a charitable organization, private foundation or public foundation within the meaning of subsection 149.1(1) of the Income Tax Act; or

cbca_s237.2_2_d.label: (d)
cbca_s237.2_2_d.text: an unsecured creditor in respect of goods or services that the creditor provided to a corporation.

cbca_part_xix_heading_apportionment_of_d.title: Apportionment of Damages
cbca_part_xix_heading_apportionment_of_d.full_citation: CBCA PART XIX.1 - Apportionment of Damages

cbca_s237.3_1.text: Subject to this section and sections 237.4 to 237.6, every defendant or third party who has been found responsible for a financial loss is liable to the plaintiff only for the portion of the damages that corresponds to their degree of responsibility for the loss.

cbca_s237.3_2.title: Uncollectable amounts
cbca_s237.3_2.text: If any part of the damages awarded against a responsible defendant or third party is uncollectable, the court may, on the application of the plaintiff, reallocate that amount to the other responsible defendants or third parties, if the application is made within one year after the date that the judgment was made enforceable.

cbca_s237.3_3.title: Reallocation
cbca_s237.3_3.text: The amount that may be reallocated to each of the other responsible defendants or third parties under subsection (2) is calculated by multiplying the uncollectable amount by the percentage that corresponds to the degree of responsibility of that defendant or third party for the total financial loss.

cbca_s237.3_4.title: Maximum amount
cbca_s237.3_4.text: The maximum amount determined under subsection (3), in respect of any responsible defendant or third party, may not be more than fifty per cent of the amount originally awarded against that responsible defendant or third party.

cbca_s237.4_1.text: The plaintiff may recover the whole amount of the damages awarded by the court from any defendant or third party who has been held responsible for a financial loss if it was established that the defendant or third party acted fraudulently or dishonestly.

cbca_s237.4_2.title: Contribution
cbca_s237.4_2.text: The defendant or third party referred to in subsection (1) is entitled to claim contribution from any other defendant or third party who is held responsible for the loss.

cbca_part_xix_heading_joint_and_several_.title: Joint and Several, or Solidary, Liability
cbca_part_xix_heading_joint_and_several_.full_citation: CBCA PART XIX.1 - Joint and Several, or Solidary, Liability

cbca_s237.5_1.text: Defendants and third parties referred to in subsection 237.2(1) are jointly and severally, or solidarily, liable for the damages awarded to a plaintiff who is an individual or a personal body corporate and who

cbca_s237.5_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s237.5_1_a.text: had a financial interest in a corporation on the day that an error, omission or misstatement in financial information concerning the corporation occurred, or acquired a financial interest in the period between the day that the error, omission or misstatement occurred and the day, as determined by the court, that it was generally disclosed; and

cbca_s237.5_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s237.5_1_b.text: has established that the value of the plaintiff’s total financial interest in the corporation was not more than the prescribed amount at the close of business on the day that the error, omission or misstatement occurred or at the close of business on any day that the plaintiff acquired a financial interest in the period referred to in paragraph (a).

cbca_s237.5_1.1.title: Exception
cbca_s237.5_1.1.text: Subsection (1) does not apply when the plaintiff brings the action as a member of a partnership or other association or as a trustee in bankruptcy, liquidator, receiver or sequestrator of a body corporate.

cbca_s237.5_2.title: Interpretation
cbca_s237.5_2.text: For the purposes of this section,

cbca_s237.5_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s237.5_2_a.text: a personal body corporate is a body corporate that is not actively engaged in any financial, commercial or industrial business and that is controlled by an individual, or by a group of individuals who are connected by marriage, common-law partnership or any legal parent-child relationship or are connected indirectly by a combination of those relationships, whether or not the individuals through whom they are connected are members of the group; and

cbca_s237.5_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s237.5_2_b.text: a common-law partnership is a relationship between two persons who are cohabiting with each other in a conjugal relationship and have done so for a period of at least one year.

cbca_s237.6_1.text: If the value of the plaintiff’s total financial interest referred to in subsection 237.5(1) is greater than the prescribed amount, a court may nevertheless determine that the defendants and third parties are jointly and severally, or solidarily, liable if the court considers that it is just and reasonable to do so.

cbca_s237.6_2.title: Factors
cbca_s237.6_2.text: The Governor in Council may establish factors that the court shall take into account in deciding whether to hold the defendants and third parties jointly and severally, or solidarily, liable.

cbca_s237.6_3.title: Statutory Instruments Act
cbca_s237.6_3.text: The Statutory Instruments Act does not apply to the factors referred to in subsection (2), but the factors shall be published in Part I of the Canada Gazette.

cbca_s237.7_1.text: When, in order to establish the value of the total financial interest referred to in subsection 237.5(1), it is necessary to determine the value of a security that is traded on an organized market, the value of the security is, on the day specified in subsection (3),

cbca_s237.7_1_a.label: (a)
cbca_s237.7_1_a.text: the closing price of that class of security;

cbca_s237.7_1_b.label: (b)
cbca_s237.7_1_b.text: if no closing price is given, the average of the highest and lowest prices of that class of security; or

cbca_s237.7_1_c.label: (c)
cbca_s237.7_1_c.text: if the security was not traded, the average of the bid and ask prices of that class of security.

cbca_s237.7_2.title: Court may adjust value
cbca_s237.7_2.text: The court may adjust the value of a security that has been determined under subsection (1) when the court considers it reasonable to do so.

cbca_s237.7_3.title: Valuation day
cbca_s237.7_3.text: The value of the security is to be determined as of the day that the error, omission or misstatement occurred. If the security was acquired in the period between that day and the day, as determined by the court, that the error, omission or misstatement was generally disclosed, the value is to be determined as of the day that it was acquired.

cbca_s237.7_4.title: Definition of organized market
cbca_s237.7_4.text: In this section, organized market means a recognized exchange for a class of securities or a market that regularly publishes the price of that class of securities in a publication that is generally available to the public.

cbca_s237.8_1.text: The court shall determine the value of all or any part of a financial interest that is subject to resale restrictions or for which there is no organized market.

cbca_s237.8_2.title: Factors
cbca_s237.8_2.text: The Governor in Council may establish factors that the court may take into account in determining value under subsection (1).

cbca_s237.8_3.title: Statutory Instruments Act
cbca_s237.8_3.text: The Statutory Instruments Act does not apply to the factors referred to in subsection (2), but the factors shall be published in Part I of the Canada Gazette.

cbca_s237.9.title: Application to determine value
cbca_s237.9.text: The plaintiff may, by application made at any time before or during the course of the proceedings, request the court to determine the value of the plaintiff’s financial interest for the purpose of subsection 237.5(1).

cbca_part_xx.label: PART XX.1
cbca_part_xx.title: Documents in Electronic or Other Form

cbca_s239_1.text: Subject to subsection (2), a complainant may apply to a court for leave to bring an action in the name and on behalf of a corporation or any of its subsidiaries, or intervene in an action to which any such body corporate is a party, for the purpose of prosecuting, defending or discontinuing the action on behalf of the body corporate.

cbca_s239_2.title: Conditions precedent
cbca_s239_2.text: No action may be brought and no intervention in an action may be made under subsection (1) unless the court is satisfied that

cbca_s239_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s239_2_a.text: the complainant has given notice to the directors of the corporation or its subsidiary of the complainant’s intention to apply to the court under subsection (1) not less than fourteen days before bringing the application, or as otherwise ordered by the court, if the directors of the corporation or its subsidiary do not bring, diligently prosecute or defend or discontinue the action;

cbca_s239_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s239_2_b.text: the complainant is acting in good faith; and

cbca_s239_2_c.label: (c)
cbca_s239_2_c.text: it appears to be in the interests of the corporation or its subsidiary that the action be brought, prosecuted, defended or discontinued.

cbca_s240.title: Powers of court
cbca_s240.text: In connection with an action brought or intervened in under section 239, the court may at any time make any order it thinks fit including, without limiting the generality of the foregoing,

cbca_s240_a.label: (a)
cbca_s240_a.text: an order authorizing the complainant or any other person to control the conduct of the action;

cbca_s240_b.label: (b)
cbca_s240_b.text: an order giving directions for the conduct of the action;

cbca_s240_c.label: (c)
cbca_s240_c.text: an order directing that any amount adjudged payable by a defendant in the action shall be paid, in whole or in part, directly to former and present security holders of the corporation or its subsidiary instead of to the corporation or its subsidiary; and

cbca_s240_d.label: (d)
cbca_s240_d.text: an order requiring the corporation or its subsidiary to pay reasonable legal fees incurred by the complainant in connection with the action.

cbca_s241_1.text: A complainant may apply to a court for an order under this section.

cbca_s241_2.title: Grounds
cbca_s241_2.text: If, on an application under subsection (1), the court is satisfied that in respect of a corporation or any of its affiliates

cbca_s241_2_a.label: (a)
cbca_s241_2_a.text: any act or omission of the corporation or any of its affiliates effects a result,

cbca_s241_2_b.label: (b)
cbca_s241_2_b.text: the business or affairs of the corporation or any of its affiliates are or have been carried on or conducted in a manner, or

cbca_s241_2_c.label: (c)
cbca_s241_2_c.text: the powers of the directors of the corporation or any of its affiliates are or have been exercised in a manner

cbca_s241_3.title: Powers of court
cbca_s241_3.text: In connection with an application under this section, the court may make any interim or final order it thinks fit including, without limiting the generality of the foregoing,

cbca_s241_3_a.label: (a)
cbca_s241_3_a.text: an order restraining the conduct complained of;

cbca_s241_3_b.label: (b)
cbca_s241_3_b.text: an order appointing a receiver or receiver-manager;

cbca_s241_3_c.label: (c)
cbca_s241_3_c.text: an order to regulate a corporation’s affairs by amending the articles or by-laws or creating or amending a unanimous shareholder agreement;

cbca_s241_3_d.label: (d)
cbca_s241_3_d.text: an order directing an issue or exchange of securities;

cbca_s241_3_e.label: (e)
cbca_s241_3_e.text: an order appointing directors in place of or in addition to all or any of the directors then in office;

cbca_s241_3_f.label: (f)
cbca_s241_3_f.text: an order directing a corporation, subject to subsection (6), or any other person, to purchase securities of a security holder;

cbca_s241_3_g.label: (g)
cbca_s241_3_g.text: an order directing a corporation, subject to subsection (6), or any other person, to pay a security holder any part of the monies that the security holder paid for securities;

cbca_s241_3_h.label: (h)
cbca_s241_3_h.text: an order varying or setting aside a transaction or contract to which a corporation is a party and compensating the corporation or any other party to the transaction or contract;

cbca_s241_3_i.label: (i)
